MiniHoTT Library

Intro.lagda

layout: page title: ‚ÄúIntroduction‚Äù toc: true agda: true gallery: true latex: true references: false linkify: true showcitation: true ‚Äî

This is a library for Univalent Type Theory in Agda developed at University of Bergen in the Programming Theory Research Group of the department of informatics.

No other libraries are required to use this Agda library. To ease its adoption, we have included synonyms and syntax sugar for types, lemmas, and theorems. Because naming things and remember names is difficult, we think all the synonyms included will alleviate this issue. Regarding performance, we would recommend you another option, maybe HoTT-Agda library. As with any other work, please see the references at the end, which they might contain better explanation of our exposition.

Code

Installation

  • Install Agda (v2.6.0+)

  • Clone this repository http://github.com/jonaprieto/mini-hott with:

    • git clone http://github.com/jonaprieto/mini-hott

  • Or install the library in ~/.agda or even better, use agda-pkg as follows:

    • pip install agda-pkg
    • apkg install mini-hott (not indexed at the moment until it‚Äôs more stable)

  • Use the library by including the following import at the top of your source code:

    • open import MiniHoTT

Style

Definitions and theorems are typed with unicode characters, we believe they improve significantly the readability. We usually present lemmas and theorems as rule inferences as in the following example.

termName
  :  {...} {t1 : type1}
  ‚Üí (t2 : type2)
  ‚Üí ...
  ---------------------
  ‚Üí ... (t1 t2) ‚Üí ...

On the website, we show the type for each term and the term definition is collapsed. However, you can expand them by clicking on the code boxes (this requires Javascript).

termName = definition
  where
  helper1 : ...
  helper2 = def...

Infix precedence:

infix X termName

Proof relevancy

To be consistent with Univalent Type Theory, we tell Agda to not use Axiom K for type-checking by using the option without-K.

{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}

In addition, without Axiom K, Agda‚Äôs Set is not a good name for universes in HoTT. So, we rename Set to Type. Our type judgments then will include the universe level as one explicit argument.

open import Agda.Primitive
  using ( Level ; lsuc; lzero; _‚äî_ ) public

Note that l ‚äî q is the maximum of two hierarchy levels l and q and we use this later on to define types in full generality.

Type
  : (‚Ñì : Level)
  ‚Üí Set (lsuc ‚Ñì)

Type ‚Ñì = Set ‚Ñì

Type‚ÇÄ
  : Type (lsuc lzero)

Type‚ÇÄ = Type lzero

The following type is to lift a type to a higher universe.

record
  ‚Üë {a : Level} ‚Ñì (A : Type a)
    : Type (a ‚äî ‚Ñì)
  where
  constructor Lift
  field
    lower : A

open ‚Üë public

Since Agda v2.6.0, it is possible to use global variables to simplify the typing. These kind of variables are implicit and included in every single type definition that comes below unless other are stated.

variable
  ‚Ñì ‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚Ñì‚±º ‚Ñì‚Çñ : Level

Type theory

Types

Empty type

A datatype without constructors is the empty type. This represents the falsehood.

data
  ‚ä• {‚Ñì·µ¢}
    : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢
  where
  -- Nothing

Synonyms of ‚ä•:

Empty = ‚ä•
ùüò     = ‚ä•

Its eliminator principle also called Ex falso quodlibet:

exfalso
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì}
  ‚Üí ‚ä• {‚Ñì·µ¢}
  --------
  ‚Üí A

exfalso ()

Synonyms of exfalso rule:

Empty-elim = exfalso
‚ä•-elim     = exfalso
ùüò-elim     = exfalso

The negation symbol is a shortcut of an implication for the falsehood.

¬¨ : Type ‚Ñì ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì
¬¨ A = (A ‚Üí ‚ä• {lzero})

Unit type

The unit type is defined as a record to get also the $Œ∑$-rule definitionally. This type has no elimination rule.

record ‚ä§ : Type ‚Ñì where
  constructor ‚òÖ

{-# BUILTIN UNIT ‚ä§ #-}

Synonyms for the Unit type:

Unit = ‚ä§
ùüô    = ‚ä§

Synonyms for the data constructor:

pattern unit = ‚òÖ
pattern ‚àó    = ‚òÖ

‚àë-types

The dependent product is called Sigma types. It‚Äôs the the type for pairs where the second term in the pair may depend on the first term.

record
  ‚àë {‚Ñì·µ¢}{‚Ñì‚±º} (A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢)(B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º)
   : Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)
  where
  constructor _,_
  field
    œÄ‚ÇÅ : A
    œÄ‚ÇÇ : B œÄ‚ÇÅ

infixr 60 _,_
open ‚àë public

Symbol synonym:

Œ£ = ‚àë  -- \Sigma and \sum

Constructor synonyms:

proj‚ÇÅ = œÄ‚ÇÅ
proj‚ÇÇ = œÄ‚ÇÇ

pr‚ÇÅ   = œÄ‚ÇÅ
pr‚ÇÇ   = œÄ‚ÇÇ

fst   = œÄ‚ÇÅ
snd   = œÄ‚ÇÇ

#     =  œÄ‚ÇÅ

Œ†-types

Œ†
  : (A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢) (P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º)
  --------------------------------
  ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)

Œ† A P = (x : A) ‚Üí P x

Synonyms

‚àè = Œ†   -- \prod vs \Pi

Products

Product type as a particular case of the Sigma type.

_√ó_
  : (A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢) (B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º)
  ----------------------------
  ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)

A √ó B = ‚àë A (Œª _ ‚Üí B)

infixl  39 _√ó_

Coproducts

Sum types as inductive types

data
  _+_ (A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢) (B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º)
    : Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)
  where
  inl : A ‚Üí A + B
  inr : B ‚Üí A + B

infixr 31 _+_

Constructors synonyms:

pattern left  = inl  -- TODO: This is not working as I expected
pattern right = inr

The elimination principle:

+-elim
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}{C : Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ}
  ‚Üí (A ‚Üí C) ‚Üí (B ‚Üí C)
  -------------------
  ‚Üí (A + B) ‚Üí C
+-elim A‚ÜíC B‚ÜíC (inl x) = A‚ÜíC x
+-elim A‚ÜíC B‚ÜíC (inr x) = B‚ÜíC x

Synonyms:

cases = +-elim

syntax cases f g = ‚ü® f + g ‚ü©

Implications

data
  _‚áí_ (A B : Type ‚Ñì)
    : Type ‚Ñì
  where
  fun : (A ‚Üí B) ‚Üí A ‚áí B

Bi-implications

_‚áî_
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ
  -------------------
  ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ)

A ‚áî B = (A ‚Üí B) √ó (B ‚Üí A)

_‚Üî_ = _‚áî_

Equalities

In HoTT, we have a different interpretation of type theory in which the set-theoretical notion of sets for types is replaced by the topological notion of spaces.

The (homogeneous) equality type also called identity type is considered a primary type (included in the theory by default). To form this type, we fix a type A and a term a : A, to have the identity type a == a, also denoted by Id(a,a) or a‚áùa. We only have one constructor of these types called idp or sometimes refl. To use identity types, we have below the J-eliminator.

data
  _==_ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} (a : A)
    : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì·µ¢
  where
  idp : a == a

-- synonyms for the identity type
Eq   = _==_
Id   = _==_
Path = _==_
_‚áù_  = _==_   -- '\r~'
_‚â°_  = _==_   -- '\equiv'

infix 30 _==_ _‚áù_ _‚â°_

{-# BUILTIN EQUALITY _==_  #-}

refl
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}
  ‚Üí (a : A)
  -----------------
  ‚Üí a == a

refl {‚Ñì·µ¢}{A} a = idp

Symmetry property for the identity types.

sym
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì}{x y : A}
  ‚Üí x == y
  --------
  ‚Üí y == x

sym idp = idp

syntax sym p = ‚àí p

To work with identity types, we have its induction principle as the J-eliminator.

Paulin-Mohring J rule

J
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {a : A}
  ‚Üí (B : (a' : A) (p : a == a') ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º)
  ‚Üí (d : B a idp)
  ----------------------------------------
  ‚Üí {a' : A} (p : a == a') ‚Üí B a' p

J {a = a} B d idp = d

J'
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {a : A}
  ‚Üí (B : (a' : A) (p : a' == a) ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º)
  ‚Üí (d : B a idp)
  ----------------------------------------
  ‚Üí {a' : A} (p : a' == a) ‚Üí B a' p

J' {a = a} B d idp = d

Basic functions

Identity functions

The identity function with implicit type.

id
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
  ----------------
  ‚Üí A ‚Üí A

id = Œª x ‚Üí x

The identity function on a type A is idf A.

idf
  : (A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢)
  ---------------
  ‚Üí (A ‚Üí A)

idf A = Œª x ‚Üí x

Constant functions

Constant function at some point b is cst b

cst
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
  ‚Üí (b : B)
  ---------
  ‚Üí (A ‚Üí B)

cst b = Œª _ ‚Üí b

Logical negation

neg¬¨
  : Bool
  ‚Üí Bool

neg¬¨ tt = ff
neg¬¨ ff = tt

Composition

A more sophisticated composition function that can handle dependent functions.

_‚àò_
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {C : (a : A) ‚Üí (B a ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ)}
  ‚Üí (g : {a : A} ‚Üí ‚àè (B a) (C a))
  ‚Üí (f : ‚àè A B)
  -------------------------------
  ‚Üí ‚àè A (Œª a ‚Üí C a (f a))

g ‚àò f = Œª x ‚Üí g (f x)

infixr 80 _‚àò_

Synonym for composition (diagrammatic version)

_:>_
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {C : (a : A) ‚Üí (B a ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ)}
  ‚Üí (f : Œ† A B)
  ‚Üí (g : {a : A} ‚Üí Œ† (B a) (C a))
  -------------------------------
  ‚Üí Œ† A (Œª a ‚Üí C a (f a))

f :> g = g ‚àò f

infixr 90 _:>_

Associativity of composition

  • Left associativity
‚àò-lassoc
  : {A B C D : Type ‚Ñì}
  ‚Üí (h : C ‚Üí D) ‚Üí (g : B ‚Üí C) ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
  -----------------------------------------
  ‚Üí (h ‚àò (g ‚àò f)) == ((h ‚àò g) ‚àò f)

‚àò-lassoc h g f = idp {a = (Œª x ‚Üí h (g (f x)))}
  • Right associativity
‚àò-rassoc
  : {A B C D : Type ‚Ñì}
  ‚Üí (h : C ‚Üí D) ‚Üí (g : B ‚Üí C) ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
  -----------------------------------------
  ‚Üí ((h ‚àò g) ‚àò f) == (h ‚àò (g ‚àò f))

‚àò-rassoc h g f = sym (‚àò-lassoc h g f)

Application

_$_
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
  ‚Üí (‚àÄ x ‚Üí B x)
  -------------
  ‚Üí (‚àÄ x ‚Üí B x)

f $ x = f x

infixr 0 _$_

Coproduct manipulation

Functions handy to manipulate coproducts:

+-map
  : ‚àÄ {i j k l} {A : Type i} {B : Type j} {A' : Type k} {B' : Type l}
  ‚Üí (A ‚Üí A')
  ‚Üí (B ‚Üí B')
  ‚Üí A + B ‚Üí A' + B'

+-map f g = cases (f :> left) (g :> right)

syntax +-map f g = ‚å© f ‚äï g ‚å™  -- Obs: Note the space after the left bracket.

parallell
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {C : (a : A) ‚Üí B a ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ}
  ‚Üí (f : (a : A) ‚Üí B a)
  ‚Üí ((a : A) ‚Üí C a (f a))
  -------------------------
  ‚Üí (a : A) ‚Üí ‚àë (B a) (C a)

parallell f g a = (f a , g a)

syntax parallell f g = ‚å© f √ó g ‚å™

e<pre class="Agda">d</pre>c<pre class="Agda">d</pre>}

Curryfication

curry
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {C : Œ£ A B ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ}
  ‚Üí ((s : ‚àë A B) ‚Üí C s)
  -------------------------------
  ‚Üí ((x : A)(y : B x) ‚Üí C (x , y))

curry f x y = f (x , y)

Uncurryfication

unCurry
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}{C : Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ}
  ‚Üí (D : (a : A) ‚Üí B a ‚Üí C)
  ------------------------
  ‚Üí (p : ‚àë A B) ‚Üí C

unCurry D p = D (proj‚ÇÅ p) (proj‚ÇÇ p)

uncurry
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {C : (a : A) ‚Üí B a ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ}
  ‚Üí (f : (a : A) (b : B a) ‚Üí C a b)
  ---------------------------------
  ‚Üí (p : ‚àë A B) ‚Üí C (œÄ‚ÇÅ p) (œÄ‚ÇÇ p)

uncurry f (x , y) = f x y

Heterogeneous equality

data
  HEq (A : Type ‚Ñì)
    : (B : Type ‚Ñì)
    ‚Üí (Œ± : A == B) (a : A) (b : B)
    ‚Üí Type (lsuc ‚Ñì)
  where
  idp : {a : A} ‚Üí HEq A A idp a a

Path functions

Composition of paths

_¬∑_
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì} {x y z : A}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ‚Üí (q : y == z)
  --------------
  ‚Üí x == z

_¬∑_ idp q = q

infixl 50 _¬∑_

Inverse of paths

inv
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a b : A}
  ‚Üí a == b
  --------
  ‚Üí b == a

inv idp = idp

Synonyms for inverse path

_‚Åª¬π = inv
!_  = inv

infixl 60 _‚Åª¬π !_

Equational reasoning

Equational reasoning is a way to write readable chains of equalities like in the following proof.

  t : a ‚â° e
  t =
    begin
      a ‚â°‚ü® p ‚ü©
      b ‚â°‚ü® q ‚ü©
      c ‚â°‚ü® r ‚ü©
      d ‚â°‚ü® s ‚ü©
      e
    ‚àé

where p is a path from a to b, q is a path from b to c, and so on.

module
  EquationalReasoning {A : Type ‚Ñì}
  where

Definitional equals:

  _==‚ü®‚ü©_
    : ‚àÄ (x {y} : A)
    -----------------
    ‚Üí x == y ‚Üí x == y

  _ ==‚ü®‚ü© p = p

Synonyms:







  _==‚ü®idp‚ü©_  = _==‚ü®‚ü©_
  _==‚ü®refl‚ü©_ = _==‚ü®‚ü©_
  _‚â°‚ü®‚ü©_      = _==‚ü®‚ü©_

  infixr 2 _==‚ü®‚ü©_ _==‚ü®idp‚ü©_ _==‚ü®refl‚ü©_ _‚â°‚ü®‚ü©_




Chain:



  _==‚ü®_‚ü©_
    : (x : A) {y z : A}
    ‚Üí x == y
    ‚Üí y == z
    --------
    ‚Üí x == z

  _ ==‚ü® thm ‚ü© q = thm ¬∑ q




Synomyms:


  _‚â°‚ü®_‚ü©_ = _==‚ü®_‚ü©_

  infixr 2 _==‚ü®_‚ü©_ _‚â°‚ü®_‚ü©_




Q.E.D:


  _‚àé
    : (x : A)
    ‚Üí x == x

  _‚àé = Œª x ‚Üí idp

  infix 3 _‚àé




The begining of a proof:



  begin_
    : {x y : A}
    ‚Üí x == y
    ‚Üí x == y

  begin_ p = p

  infix 1 begin_




open EquationalReasoning public




AlgebraOnPaths.lagda





layout: page
title: ‚ÄúAlgebra On Paths‚Äù
category: lemmas functions

Algebra of paths



ap
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
  ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B) {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A}
  ‚Üí a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ
  --------------
  ‚Üí f a‚ÇÅ == f a‚ÇÇ

ap f idp = idp




Synonyms:



cong  = ap
app-‚â° = ap

syntax app-‚â° f p = f [[ p ]]




Now, we can define a convenient syntax sugar for ap in
equational reasoning.



infixl 40 ap
syntax ap f p = p |in-ctx f




Let‚Äôs suppose we have a lemma:



  lemma : a ‚â° b
  lemma = _




used in an equational reasoning like:



  t : a ‚â° e
  t = f a ‚â°‚ü® ap f lemma ‚ü©
      f b
      ‚àé




Then, we can now put the lemma in front:



  t : a == e
  t = f a =‚ü® lemma |in-ctx f ‚ü©
      f b
      ‚àé




Lastly, we can also define actions on two paths:



ap‚ÇÇ
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {C : Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ} {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A} {b‚ÇÅ b‚ÇÇ : B}
  ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B ‚Üí C)
  ‚Üí (a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ) ‚Üí (b‚ÇÅ == b‚ÇÇ)
  --------------------------
  ‚Üí f a‚ÇÅ b‚ÇÅ  == f a‚ÇÇ b‚ÇÇ

ap‚ÇÇ f idp idp = idp




ap-¬∑
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {a b c : A}
  ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B) ‚Üí (p : a == b) ‚Üí (q : b == c)
  -------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí ap f (p ¬∑ q) == ap f p ¬∑ ap f q

ap-¬∑ f idp q = refl (ap f q)




ap-inv
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {a b : A}
  ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B) ‚Üí (p : a == b)
  ----------------------------
  ‚Üí ap f (p ‚Åª¬π) == (ap f p) ‚Åª¬π

ap-inv f idp = idp




Synonyms:


ap-! = ap-inv




ap-comp
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {C : Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ} {a b : A}
  ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
  ‚Üí (g : B ‚Üí C)
  ‚Üí (p : a == b)
  -------------------------------
  ‚Üí ap g (ap f p) == ap (g ‚àò f) p

ap-comp f g idp = idp




ap-id
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {a b : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == b)
  --------------
  ‚Üí ap id p == p

ap-id idp = idp




ap-const
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {C : Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {a b : A} {c : C}
  ‚Üí (p : a == b)
  -----------------------
  ‚Üí ap (Œª _ ‚Üí c) p == idp

ap-const {c = c} idp = refl (refl c)




Properties on the groupoid



Some properties on the groupoid structure of equalities



¬∑-runit
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a b : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == b)
  --------------
  ‚Üí p == p ¬∑ idp

¬∑-runit idp = idp




¬∑-lunit
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a b : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == b)
  --------------
  ‚Üí p == idp ¬∑ p

¬∑-lunit idp = idp




¬∑-linv
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a b : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == b)
  ----------------
  ‚Üí ! p ¬∑ p == idp

¬∑-linv idp = idp

‚â°-inverse-left = ¬∑-linv




¬∑-rinv
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a b : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == b)
  ----------------
  ‚Üí p ¬∑ ! p == idp

¬∑-rinv idp = idp

‚â°-inverse-right  = ¬∑-rinv




involution
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a b : A}
  ‚Üí {p : a == b}
  ---------------
  ‚Üí ! (! p) == p

involution {p = idp} = idp




¬∑-assoc
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a b c d : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == b) ‚Üí (q : b == c) ‚Üí (r : c == d)
  --------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí p ¬∑ q ¬∑ r == p ¬∑ (q ¬∑ r)

¬∑-assoc idp q r = idp




¬∑-cancellation
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == a) ‚Üí (q : a == a) ‚Üí p ¬∑ q == p
  -----------------------------------------
  ‚Üí q == refl a

¬∑-cancellation {a = a} p q Œ± =
    begin
      q             ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ q) (! (¬∑-linv p)) ‚ü©
      ! p ¬∑ p ¬∑ q   ==‚ü® (¬∑-assoc (! p) _ _) ‚ü©
      ! p ¬∑ (p ¬∑ q) ==‚ü® (ap (! p ¬∑_) Œ±) ‚ü©
      ! p ¬∑ p       ==‚ü® ¬∑-linv p ‚ü©
      refl a
    ‚àé




Moving a term from one side to the other is a common task,
so let‚Äôs define some handy functions for that.



¬∑-left-to-right-l
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a b c : A} {p : a == b} {q : b == c} {r : a == c}
  ‚Üí p ¬∑ q == r
  ------------------
  ‚Üí     q == ! p ¬∑ r

¬∑-left-to-right-l {a = a}{b = b}{c = c} {p} {q} {r} Œ± =
  begin
    q
      ==‚ü® ¬∑-lunit q ‚ü©
    refl b ¬∑ q
      ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ q) (! (¬∑-linv p)) ‚ü©
    (! p ¬∑ p) ¬∑ q
      ==‚ü® ¬∑-assoc (! p) p q ‚ü©
    ! p ¬∑ (p ¬∑ q)
      ==‚ü® ap (! p ¬∑_) Œ± ‚ü©
    ! p ¬∑ r
  ‚àé




¬∑-left-to-right-r
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a b c : A} {p : a == b} {q : b == c} {r : a == c}
  ‚Üí p ¬∑ q == r
  -------------------
  ‚Üí      p == r ¬∑ ! q

¬∑-left-to-right-r {a = a}{b = b}{c = c} {p} {q} {r} Œ± =
  begin
    p
      ==‚ü® ¬∑-runit p ‚ü©
    p ¬∑ refl b
      ==‚ü® ap (p ¬∑_) (! (¬∑-rinv q)) ‚ü©
    p ¬∑ (q ¬∑ ! q)
      ==‚ü® ! (¬∑-assoc p q (! q)) ‚ü©
    (p ¬∑ q) ¬∑ ! q
      ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ ! q) Œ± ‚ü©
    r ¬∑ ! q
  ‚àé




¬∑-right-to-left-r
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a b c : A} {p : a == c} {q : a == b} {r : b == c}
  ‚Üí       p == q ¬∑ r
  -------------------
  ‚Üí p ¬∑ ! r == q

¬∑-right-to-left-r {a = a}{b = b}{c = c} {p} {q} {r} Œ± =
  begin
    p ¬∑ ! r
      ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ ! r) Œ± ‚ü©
    (q ¬∑ r) ¬∑ ! r
      ==‚ü® ¬∑-assoc q r (! r) ‚ü©
    q ¬∑ (r ¬∑ ! r)
      ==‚ü® ap (q ¬∑_) (¬∑-rinv r) ‚ü©
    q ¬∑ refl b
      ==‚ü® ! (¬∑-runit q) ‚ü©
    q
    ‚àé




¬∑-right-to-left-l
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a b c : A} {p : a == c} {q : a == b} {r : b == c}
  ‚Üí       p == q ¬∑ r
  ------------------
  ‚Üí ! q ¬∑ p == r

¬∑-right-to-left-l {a = a}{b = b}{c = c} {p} {q} {r} Œ± =
  begin
    ! q ¬∑ p
      ==‚ü® ap (! q ¬∑_) Œ± ‚ü©
    ! q ¬∑ (q ¬∑ r)
      ==‚ü® ! (¬∑-assoc (! q) q r) ‚ü©
    ! q ¬∑ q ¬∑ r
      ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ r) (¬∑-linv q) ‚ü©
    refl b ¬∑ r
      ==‚ü® ! (¬∑-lunit r) ‚ü©
    r
  ‚àé




Finally, when we invert a path composition this is what we got.



!-¬∑
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a b : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == b)
  ‚Üí (q : b == a)
  --------------------------
  ‚Üí ! (p ¬∑ q) == ! q ¬∑ ! p

!-¬∑ idp q = ¬∑-runit (! q)

Transport






transport
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}
  ‚Üí (C : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º) {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ)
  -------------------------------
  ‚Üí (C a‚ÇÅ ‚Üí C a‚ÇÇ)

transport C idp = (Œª x ‚Üí x)




-- synonyms
tr     = transport
tr‚ÇÅ    = transport
transp = transport




Coercion



coe
  : ‚àÄ {A B : Type ‚Ñì}
  ‚Üí A == B
  ---------
  ‚Üí (A ‚Üí B)

coe p a = transport (Œª X ‚Üí X) p a




and its inverse:



!coe
  : ‚àÄ {A B : Type ‚Ñì}
  ‚Üí A == B
  ---------
  ‚Üí (B ‚Üí A)

!coe p a = transport (Œª X ‚Üí X) (! p) a




Pathovers



Let be A : Type, a‚ÇÅ, a‚ÇÇ : A, C : A ‚Üí Type, c‚ÇÅ : C a‚ÇÅ and c‚ÇÇ : C a‚ÇÇ.
Using the same notation from (Univalent Foundations Program, 2013), one of the definitions for the
Pathover type is as the shorthand for the path between the transport along a
path Œ± : a‚ÇÅ = a‚ÇÇ of the point c‚ÇÅ : C a‚ÇÅ and the point c‚ÇÇ in the fiber C
a‚ÇÇ. That is, a pathover is a term that inhabit the type transport C Œ± c‚ÇÅ = c‚ÇÇ
also denoted by PathOver C c‚ÇÅ Œ± c‚ÇÇ.






PathOver
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}
  ‚Üí (B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º) {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A}
  ‚Üí (b‚ÇÅ : B a‚ÇÅ) ‚Üí (Œ± : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ) ‚Üí (b‚ÇÇ : B a‚ÇÇ)
  --------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º

PathOver B b‚ÇÅ Œ± b‚ÇÇ = tr B Œ± b‚ÇÅ == b‚ÇÇ




infix 30 PathOver

syntax PathOver B b‚ÇÅ Œ± b‚ÇÇ  = b‚ÇÅ == b‚ÇÇ [ B ‚Üì Œ± ]




Another notation:



‚â°Over = PathOver




infix 30 ‚â°Over
syntax ‚â°Over B b Œ± b' = b ‚â° b' [ B / Œ± ]




Transport and composition:



tr‚ÇÅ-‚â°
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì} {a‚ÇÄ a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A}
  ‚Üí (Œ± : a‚ÇÅ ‚â° a‚ÇÇ)
  ‚Üí (Œµ : a‚ÇÄ ‚â° a‚ÇÅ)
  ‚Üí (Œ¥ : a‚ÇÄ ‚â° a‚ÇÇ)
  ‚Üí (Œµ ‚â° Œ¥ [ (Œª a' ‚Üí a‚ÇÄ ‚â° a') / Œ± ])
  ----------------------------------
  ‚Üí Œ± ‚â° ! Œµ ¬∑ Œ¥

tr‚ÇÅ-‚â° idp .idp idp idp = idp




Transport along pathovers



tr‚ÇÇ
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
  ‚Üí (C : (x : A) ‚Üí (b : B x) ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ)
  ‚Üí {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A}{b‚ÇÅ : B a‚ÇÅ}{b‚ÇÇ : B a‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí (p : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ)
  ‚Üí (q : b‚ÇÅ == b‚ÇÇ [ B ‚Üì p ])
  ‚Üí C a‚ÇÅ b‚ÇÅ
  -----------------------
  ‚Üí C a‚ÇÇ b‚ÇÇ

tr‚ÇÇ C idp idp = id




-- Gylterud's tr‚ÇÇ-commute
tr‚ÇÇ-commute
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
  ‚Üí (C : (a : A) ‚Üí (B a) ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ)
  ‚Üí (D : (a : A) ‚Üí (B a) ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì)
  ‚Üí (f : ‚àÄ a b ‚Üí C a b ‚Üí D a b)
  ‚Üí ‚àÄ {a a' b b'}
  ‚Üí (p : a ‚â° a')
  ‚Üí (q : b ‚â° b' [ B / p ])
  ‚Üí ‚àÄ c ‚Üí tr‚ÇÇ D p q (f a b c) ‚â° f a' b' (tr‚ÇÇ C p q c)

tr‚ÇÇ-commute C D f idp idp c = idp

Some lemmas on the transport operation



lift
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A} {C : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
  ‚Üí (Œ± : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ)
  ‚Üí (u : C a‚ÇÅ)
  -----------------------------
  ‚Üí (a‚ÇÅ , u) == (a‚ÇÇ , tr C Œ± u)

lift {a‚ÇÅ = a‚ÇÅ} idp u = refl (a‚ÇÅ , u)




transport-const
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {a‚ÇÅ  a‚ÇÇ : A} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
  ‚Üí (p : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ)
  ‚Üí (b : B)
  -----------------------
  ‚Üí tr (Œª _ ‚Üí B) p b == b

transport-const idp b = refl b




transport-inv-l
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}  {a a' : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == a')
  ‚Üí (b : P a')
  --------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí tr P p (tr P (! p) b) == b

transport-inv-l idp b = idp




transport-inv-r
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}  {a a' : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == a')
  ‚Üí (b : P a)
  --------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí tr P (! p) (tr P p b) == b

transport-inv-r idp _ = idp

-- synonyms
tr-inverse = transport-inv-r




transport-concat-r
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {a : A} {x y : A}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ‚Üí (q : a == x)
  ---------------------------------
  ‚Üí tr (Œª x ‚Üí a == x) p q == q ¬∑ p

transport-concat-r idp q = ¬∑-runit q




transport-concat-l
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {a : A} {x y : A}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ‚Üí (q : x == a)
  ----------------------------------
  ‚Üí tr (Œª x ‚Üí x == a) p q == ! p ¬∑ q

transport-concat-l idp q = idp




transport-concat
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {x y : A}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ‚Üí (q : x == x)
  ---------------------------------------
  ‚Üí tr (Œª x ‚Üí x == x) p q == ! p ¬∑ q ¬∑ p

transport-concat idp q = ¬∑-runit q




transport-eq-fun
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
  ‚Üí (f g : A ‚Üí B) {x y : A}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ‚Üí (q : f x == g x)
  --------------------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí tr (Œª z ‚Üí f z == g z) p q == ! (ap f p) ¬∑ q ¬∑ (ap g p)

transport-eq-fun f g idp q = ¬∑-runit q




transport-comp
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {a b c : A} {P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
  ‚Üí (p : a == b)
  ‚Üí (q : b == c)
  ---------------------------------------
  ‚Üí ((tr P q) ‚àò (tr P p)) == tr P (p ¬∑ q)

transport-comp {P = P} idp q = refl (transport P q)




transport-comp-h
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {a b c : A} {P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
  ‚Üí (p : a == b)
  ‚Üí (q : b == c)
  ‚Üí (x : P a)
  -------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí ((tr P q) ‚àò (tr P p)) x == tr P (p ¬∑ q) x

transport-comp-h {P = P} idp q x = refl (transport P q x)




transport-eq-fun-l
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {b : B} (f : A ‚Üí B) {x y : A}
  ‚Üí (p :   x == y)
  ‚Üí (q : f x == b)
  -------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí tr (Œª z ‚Üí f z == b) p q == ! (ap f p) ¬∑ q

transport-eq-fun-l {b = b} f p q =
  begin
    transport (Œª z ‚Üí f z == b) p q   ==‚ü® transport-eq-fun f (Œª _ ‚Üí b) p q ‚ü©
    ! (ap f p) ¬∑ q ¬∑ ap (Œª _ ‚Üí b) p  ==‚ü® ap (! (ap f p) ¬∑ q ¬∑_) (ap-const p) ‚ü©
    ! (ap f p) ¬∑ q ¬∑ idp             ==‚ü® ! (¬∑-runit _) ‚ü©
    ! (ap f p) ¬∑ q
  ‚àé




transport-eq-fun-r
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {b : B}
  ‚Üí (g : A ‚Üí B) {x y : A}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ‚Üí (q : b == g x)
  -----------------------------------------
  ‚Üí tr (Œª z ‚Üí b == g z) p q == q ¬∑ (ap g p)

transport-eq-fun-r {b = b} g p q =
  begin
    transport (Œª z ‚Üí b == g z) p q    ==‚ü® transport-eq-fun (Œª _ ‚Üí b) g p q ‚ü©
    ! (ap (Œª _ ‚Üí b) p) ¬∑ q ¬∑ ap g p   ==‚ü® ¬∑-assoc (! (ap (Œª _ ‚Üí b) p)) q (ap g p) ‚ü©
    ! (ap (Œª _ ‚Üí b) p) ¬∑ (q ¬∑ ap g p) ==‚ü® ap (Œª u ‚Üí ! u ¬∑ (q ¬∑ ap g p)) (ap-const p) ‚ü©
    (q ¬∑ ap g p)
  ‚àé




transport-inv
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}{a a' : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a == a')
  ‚Üí {a : P a'}
  --------------------------------------
  ‚Üí tr (Œª x ‚Üí P x) p (tr P (! p) a) == a

transport-inv {P = P}  idp {a = a} =
  begin
    tr (Œª v ‚Üí P v) idp (tr P (! idp) a)
      ==‚ü® idp ‚ü©
    tr P (! idp ¬∑ idp) a
      ==‚ü®‚ü©
    tr P idp a
      ==‚ü® idp ‚ü©
    a
  ‚àé




coe-inv-l
  : ‚àÄ {A B : Type ‚Ñì}
  ‚Üí (p : A == B)
  ‚Üí (b : B)
  --------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí tr (Œª v ‚Üí v) p (tr (Œª v ‚Üí v) (! p) b) == b

coe-inv-l idp b = idp




coe-inv-r
  : ‚àÄ {A B : Type ‚Ñì}
  ‚Üí (p : A == B)
  ‚Üí (a : A)
  ---------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí tr (Œª v ‚Üí v) (! p) (tr (Œª v ‚Üí v) p a) == a

coe-inv-r idp b = idp




transport-family
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {P : B ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ}
  ‚Üí {f : A ‚Üí B} ‚Üí {x y : A}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ‚Üí (u : P (f x))
  -----------------------------------
  ‚Üí tr (P ‚àò f) p u == tr P (ap f p) u

transport-family idp u = idp




transport-family-id
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ} ‚Üí {x y : A}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ‚Üí (u : P x)
  ----------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí transport (Œª a ‚Üí P a) p u == transport P p u

transport-family-id idp u = idp




transport-fun-coe
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}
  ‚Üí (Œ± : A ‚â° B)
  ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí A)
  ‚Üí (g : B ‚Üí B)
  ‚Üí     f == g [ (Œª X ‚Üí (X ‚Üí X)) ‚Üì Œ± ]
  -------------------------------------
  ‚Üí  f :> coe Œ± == (coe Œ±) :> g

transport-fun-coe idp _ _ idp = idp




transport-fun
  : ‚àÄ {X : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {x y : X}
  ‚Üí {A : X ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {B : X ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ‚Üí (f : A x ‚Üí B x)
  ------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí f ‚â°  ((Œª a ‚Üí tr B p (f (tr A (! p) a))))
      [ (Œª x ‚Üí A x ‚Üí B x) / p ]

transport-fun idp f = idp




-- synonyms
back-and-forth = transport-fun







transport-fun-h
  : ‚àÄ {X : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {A : X ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {B : X ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ}
  ‚Üí {x y : X}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y) ‚Üí (f : A x ‚Üí B x)
  ‚Üí (b : A y)
  --------------------------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí (tr (Œª x ‚Üí (A x ‚Üí B x)) p f) b == tr B p (f (tr A (! p) b))

transport-fun-h idp f b = idp




-- synonyms
back-and-forth-h = transport-fun-h




Now, when we transport dependent functions this is what we got:






transport-fun-dependent-h
  : ‚àÄ {X : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {A : X ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
  ‚Üí {B : (x : X) ‚Üí (a : A x) ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ} {x y : X}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ‚Üí (f : (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a)
  ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí (a' : A y)
  ‚Üí (tr (Œª x ‚Üí (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a) p f) a'
    == tr (Œª w ‚Üí B (œÄ‚ÇÅ w) (œÄ‚ÇÇ w)) (! lift (! p) a' ) (f (tr A (! p) a'))

transport-fun-dependent-h idp f a' = idp




-- synonyms
dependent-back-and-forth-h = transport-fun-dependent-h




transport-fun-dependent
  : ‚àÄ {X : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {A : X ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
  ‚Üí {B : (x : X) ‚Üí (a : A x) ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ} {x y : X}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ‚Üí (f : (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a)
  ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí (tr (Œª x ‚Üí (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a) p f)
    == Œª (a' : A y)
      ‚Üí tr (Œª w ‚Üí B (œÄ‚ÇÅ w) (œÄ‚ÇÇ w)) (! lift (! p) a' ) (f (tr A (! p) a'))

transport-fun-dependent idp f = idp




-- synonyms
dependent-back-and-forth = transport-fun-dependent




When using pathovers, we may need one of these identities:



apOver
  : ‚àÄ {A A' : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {C : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {C' : A' ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ}  -- types
  ‚Üí {a a' : A} {b : C a} {b' : C a'}                         -- points
  ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí A')
  ‚Üí (g : {x : A} ‚Üí C x ‚Üí C' (f x))
  ‚Üí (p : a == a')
  ‚Üí      b == b' [ C ‚Üì p ]
  --------------------------------
  ‚Üí    g b == g b' [ C' ‚Üì ap f p ]

apOver f g idp q = ap g q




Action on dependent paths



apd
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}  {P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {a a' : A}
  ‚Üí (f : (a : A) ‚Üí P a)
  ‚Üí (p : a == a')
  --------------------------
  ‚Üí (f a) == (f a') [ P ‚Üì p ]

apd f idp = idp




Synonyms:



fibre-app-‚â° = apd




ap2d
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {C : Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ}
  ‚Üí (F : ‚àÄ a ‚Üí B a ‚Üí C)
  ‚Üí {a a' : A} {b : B a} {b' : B a'}
  ‚Üí (p : a == a')
  ‚Üí (q : b == b' [ B ‚Üì p ])
  -------------------------
  ‚Üí  F a b == F a' b'

ap2d F idp idp = idp




ap-idp
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
   ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
   ‚Üí {a a' : A}
   ‚Üí (p : a == a')
   ------------------------------------------
   ‚Üí ap f p == idp [ (Œª x ‚Üí f x == f a') ‚Üì p ]

ap-idp f idp = idp




postulate
 ap-idp'
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º} 
  ‚Üí (f r : A ‚Üí B)
  ‚Üí (œÉ : ‚àÄ a ‚Üí f a == r a)
  ‚Üí {a a' : A}
  ‚Üí (p : a' == a)
  --------------------------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí (! (œÉ a') ¬∑ ap f p) ¬∑ (œÉ a) == idp [ (\v ‚Üí r v == r a) ‚Üì p ]

-- ap-idp' f r œÉ {a = a} idp = {!!}




‚àë and ‚àè algebra

Coproduct identities




  
module
  CoproductIdentities
  where






‚àë-‚â°
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}
  ‚Üí (B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º)
  ‚Üí {ab ab' : ‚àë A B}
  ‚Üí (p : œÄ‚ÇÅ ab ‚â° œÄ‚ÇÅ ab')
  ‚Üí œÄ‚ÇÇ ab ‚â° œÄ‚ÇÇ ab' [ B / p ]
  --------------------------
  ‚Üí ab ‚â° ab'
‚àë-‚â° B idp idp = idp




œÄ‚ÇÅ-‚â°
  : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} (B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º)
  ‚Üí {ab ab' : ‚àë A B}
  ‚Üí ab ‚â° ab'
  ----------------
  ‚Üí œÄ‚ÇÅ ab ‚â° œÄ‚ÇÅ ab'
œÄ‚ÇÅ-‚â° B idp = idp




œÄ‚ÇÇ-‚â°
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}
  ‚Üí (B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º)
  ‚Üí {ab ab' : ‚àë A B}
  ‚Üí (p : ab ‚â° ab')
  ---------------------------------------
  ‚Üí (œÄ‚ÇÇ ab) ‚â° (œÄ‚ÇÇ ab') [ B / (œÄ‚ÇÅ-‚â° B p) ]
œÄ‚ÇÇ-‚â° B idp = idp




‚àë-map
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}  {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {A' : Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ} {B' : A' ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì}
  ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí A')
  ‚Üí ((a : A) ‚Üí B a ‚Üí B' (f a))
  ----------------------------
  ‚Üí ‚àë A B ‚Üí ‚àë A' B'

‚àë-map f g p = (f (œÄ‚ÇÅ p) , g (œÄ‚ÇÅ p) (œÄ‚ÇÇ p))




‚àë-map-compose
  : ‚àÄ {i‚ÇÄ j‚ÇÄ i‚ÇÅ j‚ÇÅ i‚ÇÇ j‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí {A‚ÇÄ : Type i‚ÇÄ} {B‚ÇÄ : A‚ÇÄ ‚Üí Type j‚ÇÄ}
  ‚Üí {A‚ÇÅ : Type i‚ÇÅ} {B‚ÇÅ : A‚ÇÅ ‚Üí Type j‚ÇÅ}
  ‚Üí {A‚ÇÇ : Type i‚ÇÇ} {B‚ÇÇ : A‚ÇÇ ‚Üí Type j‚ÇÇ}
  ‚Üí (f‚ÇÄ : A‚ÇÄ ‚Üí A‚ÇÅ) ‚Üí (f‚ÇÅ : (a : A‚ÇÄ) ‚Üí B‚ÇÄ a ‚Üí B‚ÇÅ (f‚ÇÄ a))
  ‚Üí (g‚ÇÄ : A‚ÇÅ ‚Üí A‚ÇÇ) ‚Üí (g‚ÇÅ : (a : A‚ÇÅ) ‚Üí B‚ÇÅ a ‚Üí B‚ÇÇ (g‚ÇÄ a))
  ‚Üí (x : ‚àë A‚ÇÄ B‚ÇÄ)
  -------------------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí ‚àë-map (g‚ÇÄ ‚àò f‚ÇÄ) (Œª a b ‚Üí g‚ÇÅ (f‚ÇÄ a) (f‚ÇÅ a b)) x
  ‚â° (‚àë-map {B' = B‚ÇÇ} g‚ÇÄ g‚ÇÅ (‚àë-map {B' = B‚ÇÅ} f‚ÇÄ f‚ÇÅ x))

‚àë-map-compose _ _ _ _ (a , b) = idp




‚àë-lift
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {C : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ}
  ‚Üí (‚àÄ a ‚Üí B a ‚Üí C a)
  --------------------
  ‚Üí ‚àë A B ‚Üí ‚àë A C

‚àë-lift f = ‚àë-map id f




Some of the following identities are a customized version of the lemmas above.



module Sigma {‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚Ñì‚±º} {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} where




Two dependent pairs are equal if they are componentwise equal.



  
  Œ£-componentwise
    : ‚àÄ {v w : Œ£ A P}
    ‚Üí v == w
    ----------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí Œ£ (œÄ‚ÇÅ v == œÄ‚ÇÅ w) (Œª p ‚Üí tr P p (œÄ‚ÇÇ v) == œÄ‚ÇÇ w)

  Œ£-componentwise  idp = (idp , idp)




  
  Œ£-bycomponents
    : ‚àÄ {v w : Œ£ A P}
    ‚Üí Œ£ (œÄ‚ÇÅ v == œÄ‚ÇÅ w) (Œª p ‚Üí (œÄ‚ÇÇ v) == (œÄ‚ÇÇ w) [ P ‚Üì p ] )
    -----------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí v == w

  Œ£-bycomponents (idp , idp) = idp

  -- synonym of Œ£-bycomponents
  pair= = Œ£-bycomponents




A trivial consequence is the following identification:



  lift-pair=
    : ‚àÄ {x y : A} {u : P x}
    ‚Üí (p : x == y)
    --------------------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí lift {A = A}{C = P} p  u == pair= (p , refl (tr P p u))

  lift-pair= idp = idp




Uniqueness principle property for products


  uppt : (x : Œ£ A P) ‚Üí (œÄ‚ÇÅ x , œÄ‚ÇÇ x) == x
  uppt (a , b) = idp




  Œ£-ap-œÄ‚ÇÅ
    : {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A} {b‚ÇÅ : P a‚ÇÅ} {b‚ÇÇ : P a‚ÇÇ}
    ‚Üí (Œ± : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ)
    ‚Üí (Œ≥ : b‚ÇÅ == b‚ÇÇ [ P ‚Üì Œ± ])
    ------------------------------
    ‚Üí ap œÄ‚ÇÅ (pair= (Œ± , Œ≥)) == Œ±

  Œ£-ap-œÄ‚ÇÅ idp idp = idp




  -- synonym for this lemma
  ap-œÄ‚ÇÅ-pair= = Œ£-ap-œÄ‚ÇÅ




open Sigma public




transport-fun-dependent-bezem
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚Ñì‚±º} {X : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {A : X ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
      {B : (x : X) ‚Üí (a : A x) ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {x y : X}
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ‚Üí (f : (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a)
  ‚Üí (a' : A y)
  ----------------------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí (tr (Œª x ‚Üí (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a) p f) a'
    == tr (Œª w ‚Üí B (œÄ‚ÇÅ w) (œÄ‚ÇÇ w))
          (pair= (p , transport-inv p )) (f (tr A (! p) a'))

transport-fun-dependent-bezem idp f a' = idp

Product identities




  
module
  ProductIdentities
  where







prodComponentwise
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}{x y : A √ó B}
  ‚Üí (x == y)
  ---------------------------------
  ‚Üí (œÄ‚ÇÅ x == œÄ‚ÇÅ y) √ó (œÄ‚ÇÇ x == œÄ‚ÇÇ y)

prodComponentwise {x = x} idp = refl (œÄ‚ÇÅ x) , refl (œÄ‚ÇÇ x)





prodByComponents
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {x y : A √ó B}
  ‚Üí (œÄ‚ÇÅ x == œÄ‚ÇÅ y) √ó (œÄ‚ÇÇ x == œÄ‚ÇÇ y)
  ---------------------------------
  ‚Üí (x == y)

prodByComponents {x = a , b} (idp , idp) = refl (a , b)





prodCompInverse
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {x y : A √ó B}
  ‚Üí (b : (œÄ‚ÇÅ x == œÄ‚ÇÅ y) √ó (œÄ‚ÇÇ x == œÄ‚ÇÇ y))
  ---------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí prodComponentwise (prodByComponents b) == b

prodCompInverse {x = x} (idp , idp) = refl (refl (œÄ‚ÇÅ x) , refl (œÄ‚ÇÇ x))





prodByCompInverse
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {x y : A √ó B}
  ‚Üí (b : x == y)
  ---------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí prodByComponents (prodComponentwise b) == b

prodByCompInverse {x = x} idp = refl (refl x)




√ó-‚â°
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
  ‚Üí {ab ab' : A √ó B}
  ‚Üí (p : œÄ‚ÇÅ ab ‚â° œÄ‚ÇÅ ab') ‚Üí (œÄ‚ÇÇ ab) ‚â° œÄ‚ÇÇ ab'
  ‚Üí ab ‚â° ab'

√ó-‚â° idp idp = idp

When ‚àë and ‚àè commute




  
{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}

open import BasicTypes
open import BasicFunctions

open import EquivalenceType
open import QuasiinverseType






sum-commute
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}
  ‚Üí (B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º)
  ‚Üí (C : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ)
    -----------------------------------------
  ‚Üí Œ£ (Œ£ A B) (C ‚àò fst) ‚âÉ Œ£ (Œ£ A C) (B ‚àò fst)

sum-commute {A = A} B C = qinv-‚âÉ there (back , there-back , back-there)
  where
  there : Œ£ (Œ£ A B) (C ‚àò fst) ‚Üí Œ£ (Œ£ A C) (B ‚àò fst)
  there ((a , b) , c) = ((a , c ) , b)

  back : Œ£ (Œ£ A C) (B ‚àò fst) ‚Üí Œ£ (Œ£ A B) (C ‚àò fst)
  back  ((a , c ) , b) = ((a , b) , c)

  there-back : ‚àÄ acb ‚Üí there (back acb) == acb
  there-back ((a , c) , b) = idp

  back-there : ‚àÄ abc ‚Üí back (there abc) == abc
  back-there ((a , b) , c) = idp




prod-commute
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}
  ‚Üí (B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º)
  ‚Üí (C : {a : A} ‚Üí B a ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ)
  -----------------------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí (Œ£ (Œ† A B) (Œª f ‚Üí Œ† A (C ‚àò f))) ‚âÉ (Œ† A (Œª x ‚Üí Œ£ (B x) C))

prod-commute {A = A} B C = qinv-‚âÉ there (back , there-back , back-there)
  where
  there : (Œ£ (Œ† A B) (\f ‚Üí Œ† A (C ‚àò f))) ‚Üí (Œ† A (\x ‚Üí Œ£ (B x) C))
  there (f , s) x = (f x , s x)

  back : (Œ† A (\x ‚Üí Œ£ (B x) C)) ‚Üí (Œ£ (Œ† A B) (\f ‚Üí Œ† A (C ‚àò f)))
  back  F = (\x ‚Üí fst (F x)) , (\x ‚Üí snd (F x))

  there-back : ‚àÄ F ‚Üí there (back F) == F
  there-back F = idp

  back-there : ‚àÄ fs ‚Üí back (there fs) == fs
  back-there fs = idp

Fibre type



module
  FibreType {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    where




  -- Fiber
  fibre
    : (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí (b : B)
    ---------------
    ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)

  fibre f b = Œ£ A (Œª a ‚Üí f a == b)




Synomyms and syntax sugar:



  fib   = fibre
  fiber = fibre
  
  syntax fibre f b = f // b




A function applied over the fiber returns the original point



  
  fib-eq
    : ‚àÄ {f : A ‚Üí B} {b : B}
    ‚Üí (h : fib f b)
    ---------------
    ‚Üí f (proj‚ÇÅ h) == b

  fib-eq (a , Œ±) = Œ±




Each point is on the fiber of its image.



  
  fib-image
    :  ‚àÄ {f : A ‚Üí B} ‚Üí {a : A}
    ‚Üí fib f (f a)

  fib-image {f} {a} = a , refl (f a)

Homotopies




  
In a type-theoretical sense, a homotopy between two
functions is a family of equalities between their applications.





The context:


module HomotopyType {‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚Ñì‚±º} {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} where




Let  be two sections of a
type family . A homotopy from  to 
is a dependent function of type





Homotopy types



  
  homotopy
    : (f g : Œ† A P)
    ---------------
    ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)

  homotopy f g = ‚àÄ (x : A) ‚Üí f x == g x




  -- Usual notation for homotopy
  _‚àº_ : (f g : ((x : A) ‚Üí P x)) ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)
  f ‚àº g = homotopy f g




Homotopy is an equivalence relation



  -- Homotopy is an equivalence relation
  h-refl
    : (f : Œ† A P)
    -------------
    ‚Üí f ‚àº f

  h-refl f x = idp




  
  h-sym
    : (f g : Œ† A P)
    ‚Üí f ‚àº g
    -------
    ‚Üí g ‚àº f

  h-sym _ _ e x = ! (e x)




  
  h-comp
    : {f g h : Œ† A P}
    ‚Üí f ‚àº g
    ‚Üí g ‚àº h
    -------
    ‚Üí f ‚àº h

  h-comp u v x = (u x) ¬∑ (v x)




  -- synonym for h-comp
  _‚óè_
    : {f g h : Œ† A P}
    ‚Üí f ‚àº g
    ‚Üí g ‚àº h
    -------
    ‚Üí f ‚àº h

  Œ± ‚óè Œ≤ = h-comp Œ± Œ≤

Composition with homotopies



hl-comp
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {C : Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ}
  ‚Üí {f g : A ‚Üí B}
  ‚Üí {j k : B ‚Üí C}
  ‚Üí f ‚àº g
  ‚Üí j ‚àº k
  -------------------
  ‚Üí (j ‚àò f) ‚àº (k ‚àò g)

hl-comp {g = g}{j = j} f-g j-k = Œª x ‚Üí ap j (f-g x) ¬∑ j-k (g x)




rcomp-‚àº
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {C : Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ}
  ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
  ‚Üí {j k : B ‚Üí C}
  ‚Üí j ‚àº k
  -------------------
  ‚Üí (j ‚àò f) ‚àº (k ‚àò f)

rcomp-‚àº f j-k = hl-comp (h-refl f) j-k




lcomp-‚àº
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {C : Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ}
  ‚Üí {f g : A ‚Üí B}
  ‚Üí (j : B ‚Üí C)
  ‚Üí f ‚àº g
  -------------------
  ‚Üí (j ‚àò f) ‚àº (j ‚àò g)

lcomp-‚àº j Œ± = hl-comp Œ± (h-refl j)




Naturality



Homotopy is natural, meaning that it satisfies the following
square commutative diagram.






h-naturality
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
  ‚Üí {f g : A ‚Üí B} ‚Üí {x y : A}
  ‚Üí (H : f ‚àº g)
  ‚Üí (p : x == y)
  ------------------------------
  ‚Üí H x ¬∑ ap g p == ap f p ¬∑ H y

h-naturality {x = x} H idp = ! (¬∑-runit (H x))




A particular case of naturality on the identity function.



h-naturality-id
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì} {f : A ‚Üí A} ‚Üí {x : A}
  ‚Üí (H : f ‚àº id)
  -----------------------
  ‚Üí H (f x) == ap f (H x)

h-naturality-id {f = f} {x = x} H =
  begin
    H (f x)
      ==‚ü® ¬∑-runit (H (f x)) ‚ü©
    H (f x) ¬∑ refl (f x)
      ==‚ü® ap (H (f x) ¬∑_) (! (¬∑-rinv (H x))) ‚ü©
    H (f x) ¬∑ ((H x) ¬∑ (! (H x)))
      ==‚ü® ap (H (f x) ¬∑_) (ap (_¬∑ (! (H x))) (! ap-id (H x))) ‚ü©
    H (f x) ¬∑ (ap id (H x) ¬∑ ! (H x))
      ==‚ü® ! (¬∑-assoc (H (f x)) (ap id (H x)) (! (H x))) ‚ü©
    (H (f x) ¬∑ ap id (H x)) ¬∑ ! (H x)
      ==‚ü® ¬∑-right-to-left-r (h-naturality H (H x)) ‚ü©
    ap f (H x)
  ‚àé

Function extensionality




module FunExtAxiom {‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚Ñì‚±º} {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}
  {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {f g : (a : A) ‚Üí B a} where




  -- Application of an homotopy
  happly
    : f == g
    ------------------------
    ‚Üí ((x : A) ‚Üí f x == g x)

  happly idp x = refl (f x)

  -- synonyms:
  ‚â°-app = happly




  postulate
    axiomFunExt : isEquiv happly




  eqFunExt
    : (f == g) ‚âÉ ((x : A) ‚Üí f x == g x)

  eqFunExt = happly , axiomFunExt




  -- From this, the usual notion of function extensionality follows.
  funext
    : ((x : A) ‚Üí f x == g x)
    ------------------------
    ‚Üí f == g

  funext = remap eqFunExt




  -- Beta and eta rules for function extensionality
  funext-Œ≤
    : (h : ((x : A) ‚Üí f x == g x))
    ------------------------------
    ‚Üí happly (funext h) == h

  funext-Œ≤ h = lrmap-inverse eqFunExt




  funext-Œ∑
    : (p : f == g)
    ------------------------
    ‚Üí funext (happly p) == p

  funext-Œ∑ p = rlmap-inverse eqFunExt

Function extensionality in the transport case



module
  FunExtTransport {X : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {A B : X ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {x y : X}
    where




  funext-transport
    : (p : x == y) ‚Üí (f : A x ‚Üí B x) ‚Üí (g : A y ‚Üí B y)
    ------------------------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí (tr (Œª z‚ÇÅ ‚Üí (x : A z‚ÇÅ) ‚Üí B z‚ÇÅ) p f == g)
    ‚âÉ ((a : A(x)) ‚Üí tr B p (f a) == g (tr A p a))

  funext-transport idp f g = eqFunExt




  funext-transport-l
    : (p : x == y)
    ‚Üí (f : A x ‚Üí B x)
    ‚Üí (g : A y ‚Üí B y)
    ‚Üí ((tr (Œª z‚ÇÅ ‚Üí (x : A z‚ÇÅ) ‚Üí B z‚ÇÅ) p f == g)
    -------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí ((a : A(x)) ‚Üí tr B p (f a) == g (tr A p a)))

  funext-transport-l p f g = lemap (funext-transport p _ _)




  funext-transport-r
    : (p : x == y)
    ‚Üí (f : A x ‚Üí B x)
    ‚Üí (g : A y ‚Üí B y)
    ‚Üí ((a : A(x)) ‚Üí tr B p (f a) == g (tr A p a))
    -------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí (tr (Œª z‚ÇÅ ‚Üí (x : A z‚ÇÅ) ‚Üí B z‚ÇÅ) p f == g)

  funext-transport-r p f g = remap (funext-transport p _ _)

funext-transport-dfun-bezem
  : {X : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{A : X ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}{B : (x : X) ‚Üí A x ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} {x y : X}

  ‚Üí (a : A y)
  ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  ‚Üí (tr (Œª x ‚Üí (a : A x) ‚Üí B x a) p f) a == g a
  ‚âÉ  tr (Œª w ‚Üí B (œÄ‚ÇÅ w) (œÄ‚ÇÇ w)) (pair= (p , transport-inv p)) (f (tr A (! p)a)) == g a

Decidable equality



A type has decidable equality if any two of its
elements are equal or different. This would be a particular
instance of the Law of Excluded Middle that holds even if we do not
assume Excluded Middle.



module DecidableEquality {‚Ñì} where

  -- A type has decidable equality if we can prove that any two of its
  -- elements are equal or different.
  decEq : (A : Type ‚Ñì) ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì
  decEq A = (a b : A) ‚Üí (a == b) + ¬¨ (a == b)

  -- The product of types with decidable equality is a type with
  -- decidable equality.
  decEqProd
    : {A B : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí decEq A ‚Üí decEq B
    -------------------
    ‚Üí decEq (A √ó B)

  decEqProd da db (a1 , b1) (a2 , b2) with (da a1 a2) | (db b1 b2)
  decEqProd da db (a1 , b1) (a2 , b2) | inl aeq | inl beq = inl (prodByComponents (aeq , beq))
  decEqProd da db (a1 , b1) (a2 , b2) | inl aeq | inr bnq = inr Œª b ‚Üí bnq (ap œÄ‚ÇÇ b)
  decEqProd da db (a1 , b1) (a2 , b2) | inr anq | u       = inr Œª b ‚Üí anq (ap œÄ‚ÇÅ b)

Equivalences



There are three definitions to say a function is an
equivalence. All these definitions
are required to be mere propositions and to hold
the bi-implication of begin quasi-inverse. We show
this clearly in what follows. Nevertheless, we want to get
the following fact:





Contractible maps



A map is contractible if the fiber in any point is contractible, that is, each
element has a unique preimagen.



isContrMap
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
  ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
  ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)

isContrMap {B = B} f = (b : B) ‚Üí isContr (fib f b)


map-contractible = isContrMap




There exists an equivalence between two types if there exists a
contractible function between them.



isEquiv
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
  ‚Üí  (f : A ‚Üí B)
  ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)

isEquiv f = isContrMap f




Synomyms:



isEquivalence  = isEquiv
is-equivalence = isEquiv 




Equivalence Type



_‚âÉ_
  : (A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢) (B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º)
  ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)

A ‚âÉ B = Œ£ (A ‚Üí B) isEquiv




module EquivalenceMaps {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º} where




  lemap
    : A ‚âÉ B
    -------
    ‚Üí (A ‚Üí B)

  lemap = œÄ‚ÇÅ




Synonyms:



  ‚âÉ-to-‚Üí = lemap
  fun‚âÉ   = lemap
  _‚àô     = lemap
  _‚àô‚Üí    = lemap
  apply  = lemap

  infixl 70 _‚àô _‚àô‚Üí




  remap
    : A ‚âÉ B
    ---------
    ‚Üí (B ‚Üí A)

  remap (f , contrf) b = œÄ‚ÇÅ (œÄ‚ÇÅ (contrf b))




  ‚âÉ-to-‚Üê  = remap
  invfun‚âÉ = remap
  _‚àô‚Üê     = remap

  infixl 70 _‚àô‚Üê




The maps of an equivalence are inverses in particular



  lrmap-inverse
    : (e : A ‚âÉ B) ‚Üí {b : B}
    -----------------------
    ‚Üí (e ‚àô‚Üí) ((e ‚àô‚Üê) b) == b

  lrmap-inverse (f , eqf) {b} = fib-eq (œÄ‚ÇÅ (eqf b))




  ‚àô‚Üí‚àò‚àô‚Üê = lrmap-inverse




  rlmap-inverse
    : (e : A ‚âÉ B) ‚Üí {a : A}
    ------------------------
    ‚Üí (e ‚àô‚Üê) ((e ‚àô‚Üí) a) == a

  rlmap-inverse (f , eqf) {a} = ap œÄ‚ÇÅ ((œÄ‚ÇÇ (eqf (f a))) fib-image)



  ‚àô‚Üê‚àò‚àô‚Üí = rlmap-inverse




  lrmap-inverse-h
    : (e : A ‚âÉ B)
    ------------------------
    ‚Üí ((e ‚àô‚Üí) ‚àò (e ‚àô‚Üê)) ‚àº id

  lrmap-inverse-h e = Œª x ‚Üí lrmap-inverse e {x}




  ‚àô‚Üí‚àò‚àô‚Üê-h = lrmap-inverse-h




  rlmap-inverse-h
    : (e : A ‚âÉ B)
    ------------------------
    ‚Üí ((e ‚àô‚Üê) ‚àò (e ‚àô‚Üí)) ‚àº id

  rlmap-inverse-h e = Œª x ‚Üí rlmap-inverse e {x}




  ‚àô‚Üê‚àò‚àô‚Üí-h = rlmap-inverse-h

Quasiinverses



Two functions are quasi-inverses if we can construct a function providing
(g ‚àò f) x = x and (f ‚àò g) y = y for any given x and y.




  
{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}
open import TransportLemmas
open import EquivalenceType

open import HomotopyType
open import HomotopyLemmas


open import HalfAdjointType






module QuasiinverseType {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º} where




  qinv
    : (A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)

  qinv f = Œ£ (B ‚Üí A) (Œª g ‚Üí ((f ‚àò g) ‚àº id) √ó ((g ‚àò f) ‚àº id))

  quasiinverse = qinv




  linv
    : (A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)
    
  linv f = Œ£ (B ‚Üí A) (Œª g ‚Üí (g ‚àò f) ‚àº idf A)

  left-inverse = linv




  rinv
    : (A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)
    
  rinv f = Œ£ (B ‚Üí A) (Œª g ‚Üí (f ‚àò g) ‚àº idf B)

  right-inverse = rinv




Biinverse is another equivalent notion of the right equivalence for HoTT.


  biinv : (A ‚Üí B) ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)
  biinv f = linv f √ó rinv f

  biinverse  = biinv
  bi-inverse = biinv




A desire consequence (qinv ‚Üí biinv):



  qinv-biinv : (f : A ‚Üí B) ‚Üí qinv f ‚Üí biinv f
  qinv-biinv f (g , (u1 , u2)) = (g , u2) , (g , u1)

  biinv-qinv : (f : A ‚Üí B) ‚Üí biinv f ‚Üí qinv f
  biinv-qinv f ((h , Œ±) , (g , Œ≤)) = g , (Œ≤ , Œ¥)
    where
      Œ≥1 : g ‚àº ((h ‚àò f) ‚àò g)
      Œ≥1 = rcomp-‚àº g (h-sym (h ‚àò f) id Œ±)

      Œ≥2 : ((h ‚àò f) ‚àò g) ‚àº (h ‚àò (f ‚àò g))
      Œ≥2 x = idp

      Œ≥ : g ‚àº h
      Œ≥ = Œ≥1 ‚óè (Œ≥2 ‚óè (lcomp-‚àº h Œ≤))

      Œ¥ : (g ‚àò f) ‚àº id
      Œ¥ = (rcomp-‚àº f Œ≥) ‚óè Œ±

  equiv-biinv : (f : A ‚Üí B) ‚Üí isContrMap f ‚Üí biinv f
  equiv-biinv f contrf =
    (remap eq , rlmap-inverse-h eq) , (remap eq , lrmap-inverse-h eq)
    where
      eq : A ‚âÉ B
      eq = f , contrf

  -- Quasiinverses are halfadjoint equivalences.
  qinv-ishae : {f : A ‚Üí B} ‚Üí qinv f ‚Üí ishae f
  qinv-ishae {f} (g , (Œµ , Œ∑)) = record {
      g = g ;
      Œ∑ = Œ∑ ;
      Œµ = Œª b ‚Üí inv (Œµ (f (g b))) ¬∑ ap f (Œ∑ (g b)) ¬∑ Œµ b ;
      œÑ = œÑ
    }
    where
      aux-lemma : (a : A) ‚Üí ap f (Œ∑ (g (f a))) ¬∑ Œµ (f a) == Œµ (f (g (f a))) ¬∑ ap f (Œ∑ a)
      aux-lemma a =
        begin
          ap f (Œ∑ ((g ‚àò f) a)) ¬∑ Œµ (f a)
            ==‚ü® ap (Œª u ‚Üí ap f u ¬∑ Œµ (f a)) (h-naturality-id Œ∑) ‚ü©
          ap f (ap (g ‚àò f) (Œ∑ a)) ¬∑ Œµ (f a)
            ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ Œµ (f a)) (ap-comp (g ‚àò f) f (Œ∑ a)) ‚ü©
          ap (f ‚àò (g ‚àò f)) (Œ∑ a) ¬∑ Œµ (f a)
            ==‚ü® inv (h-naturality (Œª x ‚Üí Œµ (f x)) (Œ∑ a)) ‚ü©
          Œµ (f (g (f a))) ¬∑ ap f (Œ∑ a)
        ‚àé

      œÑ : (a : A) ‚Üí ap f (Œ∑ a) == (inv (Œµ (f (g (f a)))) ¬∑ ap f (Œ∑ (g (f a))) ¬∑ Œµ (f a))
      œÑ a =
        begin
          ap f (Œ∑ a)
            ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ ap f (Œ∑ a)) (inv (¬∑-linv (Œµ (f (g (f a)))))) ‚ü©
          inv (Œµ (f (g (f a)))) ¬∑ Œµ (f (g (f a))) ¬∑ ap f (Œ∑ a)
            ==‚ü® ¬∑-assoc (inv (Œµ (f (g (f a))))) _ (ap f (Œ∑ a)) ‚ü©
          inv (Œµ (f (g (f a)))) ¬∑ (Œµ (f (g (f a))) ¬∑ ap f (Œ∑ a))
            ==‚ü® ap (inv (Œµ (f (g (f a)))) ¬∑_) (inv (aux-lemma a)) ‚ü©
          inv (Œµ (f (g (f a)))) ¬∑ (ap f (Œ∑ (g (f a))) ¬∑ Œµ (f a))
            ==‚ü® inv (¬∑-assoc (inv (Œµ (f (g (f a))))) _ (Œµ (f a))) ‚ü©
          inv (Œµ (f (g (f a)))) ¬∑ ap f (Œ∑ (g (f a))) ¬∑ Œµ (f a)
        ‚àé




Quasiinverses create equivalences.



  qinv-‚âÉ
    : (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí qinv f
    -------------
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ B
    
  qinv-‚âÉ f = ishae-‚âÉ ‚àò qinv-ishae




  ‚âÉ-qinv
    : A ‚âÉ B
    ----------------
    ‚Üí Œ£ (A ‚Üí B) qinv
 
  ‚âÉ-qinv eq =
    lemap eq , (remap eq , (lrmap-inverse-h eq , rlmap-inverse-h eq))




Half-adjoint equivalences are quasiinverses.



  ishae-qinv
    : {f : A ‚Üí B}
    ‚Üí ishae f
    ---------
    ‚Üí qinv f
    
  ishae-qinv {f} (hae g Œ∑ Œµ œÑ) = g , (Œµ , Œ∑)




  ‚âÉ-ishae
    : (e : A ‚âÉ B)
    --------------
    ‚Üí ishae (e ‚àô‚Üí)
    
  ‚âÉ-ishae e = qinv-ishae (œÄ‚ÇÇ (‚âÉ-qinv e))

Quasiinverse Lemmas



Two functions are quasi-inverses if we can construct a function providing
(g ‚àò f) x = x and (f ‚àò g) y = y for any given x and y.




  
{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}
open import TransportLemmas
open import EquivalenceType

open import HomotopyType
open import HomotopyLemmas


open import QuasiinverseType






Equivalence composition



module QuasiinverseLemmas where




The equivalence types are indeed equivalence



  -- Composition of quasiinverses
  qinv-comp
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}{C : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
    ‚Üí Œ£ (A ‚Üí B) qinv
    ‚Üí Œ£ (B ‚Üí C) qinv
    ----------------
    ‚Üí Œ£ (A ‚Üí C) qinv

  qinv-comp (f , (if , (Œµf , Œ∑f))) (g , (ig , (Œµg , Œ∑g))) = (g ‚àò f) , ((if ‚àò ig) ,
     ( (Œª x ‚Üí ap g (Œµf (ig x)) ¬∑ Œµg x)
     ,  Œª x ‚Üí ap if (Œ∑g (f x)) ¬∑ Œ∑f x))




  -- Lemma.
  qinv-inv
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
    ‚Üí Œ£ (A ‚Üí B) qinv
    ----------------
    ‚Üí Œ£ (B ‚Üí A) qinv

  qinv-inv (f , (g , (Œµ , Œ∑))) = g , (f , (Œ∑ , Œµ))




Equivalence types are equivalence relations.



  idEqv
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì} {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    -------
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ A

  idEqv = id , Œª a ‚Üí (a , refl a) , Œª { (_ , idp) ‚Üí refl (a , refl a) }

  -- Synonyms
  ‚âÉ-refl = idEqv
  A‚âÉA    = idEqv




  -- Lemma.
  _:>‚âÉ_
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}{C : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ B
    ‚Üí B ‚âÉ C
    -------
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ C

  _:>‚âÉ_ {A = A} {C = C} eq-f eq-g = qinv-‚âÉ (œÄ‚ÇÅ qcomp) (œÄ‚ÇÇ qcomp)
   where
     qcomp : Œ£ (A ‚Üí C) qinv
     qcomp = qinv-comp (‚âÉ-qinv eq-f) (‚âÉ-qinv eq-g)

  -- Synonyms
  compEqv = _:>‚âÉ_
  ‚âÉ-trans = _:>‚âÉ_
  _‚àò‚âÉ_    = _:>‚âÉ_




  ‚âÉ-sym
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ B
    -------
    ‚Üí B ‚âÉ A

  ‚âÉ-sym {‚Ñì}{_} {A} {B} eq-f = qinv-‚âÉ (œÄ‚ÇÅ qcinv) (œÄ‚ÇÇ qcinv)
   where
     qcinv : Œ£ (B ‚Üí A) qinv
     qcinv = qinv-inv (‚âÉ-qinv eq-f)

  -- Synonyms
  invEqv = ‚âÉ-sym
  ‚âÉ-flip = ‚âÉ-sym

Biinverses



Two functions are quasi-inverses if we can construct a function providing
(g ‚àò f) x = x and (f ‚àò g) y = y for any given x and y.




  
{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}
open import TransportLemmas






module
  BiinverseEquivalenceType {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
   where




  record
    Equivalence {‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚Ñì‚±º} {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º} (f : A ‚Üí B)
    : Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî  ‚Ñì‚±º)
    where
    constructor equivalence
    field
      left-inverse   : B ‚Üí A
      right-inverse  : B ‚Üí A
      left-identity  : ‚àÄ a ‚Üí  left-inverse (f a) ‚â° a
      right-identity : ‚àÄ b ‚Üí f (right-inverse b) ‚â° b

  infix 10 _‚âÉ_




Synonym:


  biinv
    :  {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî  ‚Ñì‚±º)
  biinv f = Equivalence f




  isequiv
    :  {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî  ‚Ñì‚±º)
  isequiv f = Equivalence f




  record
    _‚âÉ_ {‚Ñì·µ¢}{‚Ñì‚±º} (A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢) (B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º)
    : Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)
    where
    constructor eq
    field
      apply-eq : A ‚Üí B
      biinverse : Equivalence apply-eq




  ide
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì·µ¢} {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ A

  ide = eq id (equivalence id id (Œª a ‚Üí idp) (Œª a ‚Üí idp))




  ‚âÉ-from-‚â°
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}
    ‚Üí (F : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º)
    ‚Üí (a b : A)
    ‚Üí a ‚â° b ‚Üí F a ‚âÉ F b

  ‚âÉ-from-‚â° F a b p = tr‚ÇÅ (_‚âÉ_ _ ‚àò F) p ide

Half-adjoints



Half-adjoints are an auxiliary notion that helps us to define a suitable notion
of equivalence, meaning that it is a proposition and that it captures the usual
notion of equivalence.




  
{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}
open import Transport
open import TransportLemmas

open import ProductIdentities
open import CoproductIdentities

open import EquivalenceType

open import HomotopyType
open import HomotopyLemmas
open import FibreType






module
  HalfAdjointType {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    where




Half adjoint equivalence:


    record
      ishae (f : A ‚Üí B)
      : Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)
      where
      constructor hae
      field
        g : B ‚Üí A
        Œ∑ : (g ‚àò f) ‚àº id
        Œµ : (f ‚àò g) ‚àº id
        œÑ : (a : A) ‚Üí ap f (Œ∑ a) == Œµ (f a)




Half adjoint equivalences give contractible fibers.



    ishae-contr
      : (f : A ‚Üí B)
      ‚Üí ishae f
      -------------
      ‚Üí isContrMap f

    ishae-contr f (hae g Œ∑ Œµ œÑ) y = ((g y) , (Œµ y)) , contra
      where
        lemma : (c c' : fib f y) ‚Üí Œ£ (œÄ‚ÇÅ c == œÄ‚ÇÅ c') (Œª Œ≥ ‚Üí (ap f Œ≥) ¬∑ œÄ‚ÇÇ c' == œÄ‚ÇÇ c) ‚Üí c == c'
        lemma c c' (p , q) = Œ£-bycomponents (p , lemma2)
          where
            lemma2 : transport (Œª z ‚Üí f z == y) p (œÄ‚ÇÇ c) == œÄ‚ÇÇ c'
            lemma2 =
              begin
                transport (Œª z ‚Üí f z == y) p (œÄ‚ÇÇ c)
                  ==‚ü® transport-eq-fun-l f p (œÄ‚ÇÇ c) ‚ü©
                inv (ap f p) ¬∑ (œÄ‚ÇÇ c)
                  ==‚ü® ap (inv (ap f p) ¬∑_) (inv q) ‚ü©
                inv (ap f p) ¬∑ ((ap f p) ¬∑ (œÄ‚ÇÇ c'))
                  ==‚ü® inv (¬∑-assoc (inv (ap f p)) (ap f p) (œÄ‚ÇÇ c')) ‚ü©
                inv (ap f p) ¬∑ (ap f p) ¬∑ (œÄ‚ÇÇ c')
                  ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ (œÄ‚ÇÇ c')) (¬∑-linv (ap f p)) ‚ü©
                œÄ‚ÇÇ c'
              ‚àé

        contra : (x : fib f y) ‚Üí (g y , Œµ y) == x
        contra (x , p) = lemma (g y , Œµ y) (x , p) (Œ≥ , lemma3)
          where
            Œ≥ : g y == x
            Œ≥ = inv (ap g p) ¬∑ Œ∑ x

            lemma3 : (ap f Œ≥ ¬∑ p) == Œµ y
            lemma3 =
              begin
                ap f Œ≥ ¬∑ p
                  ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ p) (ap-¬∑ f (inv (ap g p)) (Œ∑ x)) ‚ü©
                ap f (inv (ap g p)) ¬∑ ap f (Œ∑ x) ¬∑ p
                  ==‚ü® ¬∑-assoc (ap f (inv (ap g p))) _ p ‚ü©
                ap f (inv (ap g p)) ¬∑ (ap f (Œ∑ x) ¬∑ p)
                  ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ (ap f (Œ∑ x) ¬∑ p)) (ap-inv f (ap g p)) ‚ü©
                inv (ap f (ap g p)) ¬∑ (ap f (Œ∑ x) ¬∑ p)
                  ==‚ü® ap (Œª u ‚Üí inv (ap f (ap g p)) ¬∑ (u ¬∑ p)) (œÑ x) ‚ü©
                inv (ap f (ap g p)) ¬∑ (Œµ (f x) ¬∑ p)
                  ==‚ü® ap (Œª u ‚Üí inv (ap f (ap g p)) ¬∑ (Œµ (f x) ¬∑ u)) (inv (ap-id p)) ‚ü©
                inv (ap f (ap g p)) ¬∑ (Œµ (f x) ¬∑ ap id p)
                  ==‚ü® ap (inv (ap f (ap g p)) ¬∑_) (h-naturality Œµ p) ‚ü©
                inv (ap f (ap g p)) ¬∑ (ap (f ‚àò g) p ¬∑ Œµ y)
                  ==‚ü® ap (Œª u ‚Üí inv u ¬∑ (ap (f ‚àò g) p ¬∑ Œµ y)) (ap-comp g f p) ‚ü©
                inv (ap (f ‚àò g) p) ¬∑ (ap (f ‚àò g) p ¬∑ Œµ y)
                  ==‚ü® inv (¬∑-assoc (inv (ap (f ‚àò g) p)) _ (Œµ y)) ‚ü©
                (inv (ap (f ‚àò g) p) ¬∑ ap (f ‚àò g) p) ¬∑ Œµ y
                  ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ Œµ y) (¬∑-linv (ap (Œª z ‚Üí f (g z)) p)) ‚ü©
                Œµ y
              ‚àé




Half-adjointness implies equivalence:


    ishae-‚âÉ
      : {f : A ‚Üí B}
      ‚Üí ishae f
      ---------
      ‚Üí A ‚âÉ B

    ishae-‚âÉ ishaef = _ , (ishae-contr _ ishaef)

  _‚âÉ‚ü®‚ü©_

    : (A {B} : Type ‚Ñì)

  _ ‚âÉ‚ü®by-def‚ü© e = e

    : (A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢) {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}{C : Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ}

    ---------------
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ C

  infixr 2 _‚âÉ‚ü®_‚ü©_




  _‚âÉ‚àé

    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ A

    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ B

module SigmaEquivalence {‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚Ñì‚±º} {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º} where




  
  pair=Equiv
    : {v w : Œ£ A P}
    ‚Üí Œ£ (œÄ‚ÇÅ v == œÄ‚ÇÅ w) (Œª p ‚Üí tr (Œª a ‚Üí P a) p (œÄ‚ÇÇ v) == œÄ‚ÇÇ w) ‚âÉ v == w

  pair=Equiv = qinv-‚âÉ Œ£-bycomponents (Œ£-componentwise , HŒ£‚ÇÅ , HŒ£‚ÇÇ)
    where
      HŒ£‚ÇÅ : Œ£-bycomponents ‚àò Œ£-componentwise ‚àº id
      HŒ£‚ÇÅ idp = idp

      HŒ£‚ÇÇ : Œ£-componentwise ‚àò Œ£-bycomponents ‚àº id
      HŒ£‚ÇÇ (idp , idp) = idp

  private
    f : {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A} {Œ± : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ}{c‚ÇÅ : P a‚ÇÅ} {c‚ÇÇ : P a‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí {Œ≤ : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí {Œ≥ : transport P Œ≤ c‚ÇÅ == c‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí ap œÄ‚ÇÅ (pair= (Œ≤ , Œ≥)) == Œ± ‚Üí Œ≤ == Œ±
    f {Œ≤ = idp} {Œ≥ = idp} idp = idp

    g : {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A} {Œ± : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ}{c‚ÇÅ : P a‚ÇÅ} {c‚ÇÇ : P a‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí {Œ≤ : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí {Œ≥ : transport P Œ≤ c‚ÇÅ == c‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí Œ≤ == Œ± ‚Üí ap œÄ‚ÇÅ (pair= (Œ≤ , Œ≥)) == Œ±
    g {Œ≤ = idp} {Œ≥ = idp} idp = idp

    f-g : {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A} {Œ± : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ}{c‚ÇÅ : P a‚ÇÅ} {c‚ÇÇ : P a‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí {Œ≤ : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí {Œ≥ : transport P Œ≤ c‚ÇÅ == c‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí f {Œ± = Œ±}{Œ≤ = Œ≤}{Œ≥} ‚àò g {Œ± = Œ±}{Œ≤ = Œ≤} ‚àº id
    f-g {Œ≤ = idp} {Œ≥ = idp} idp = idp

    g-f : {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A} {Œ± : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ}{c‚ÇÅ : P a‚ÇÅ} {c‚ÇÇ : P a‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí {Œ≤ : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí {Œ≥ : transport P Œ≤ c‚ÇÅ == c‚ÇÇ}
      ‚Üí g {Œ± = Œ±}{Œ≤ = Œ≤}{Œ≥} ‚àò f {Œ± = Œ±}{Œ≤ = Œ≤}{Œ≥} ‚àº id
    g-f {Œ≤ = idp} {Œ≥ = idp} idp = idp




  -- Lemma
  ap-œÄ‚ÇÅ-pair=Equiv
    : {a‚ÇÅ a‚ÇÇ : A} {c‚ÇÅ : P a‚ÇÅ} {c‚ÇÇ : P a‚ÇÇ}
    ‚Üí (Œ± : a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ)
    ‚Üí (Œ≥ : Œ£ (a‚ÇÅ == a‚ÇÇ) (Œª p ‚Üí c‚ÇÅ == c‚ÇÇ [ P ‚Üì p ]))
    ‚Üí (ap œÄ‚ÇÅ (pair= Œ≥) == Œ±) ‚âÉ (œÄ‚ÇÅ Œ≥ == Œ±)

  ap-œÄ‚ÇÅ-pair=Equiv {a‚ÇÅ = a‚ÇÅ} Œ± (Œ≤ , Œ≥) = qinv-‚âÉ f (g , f-g , g-f)

{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}
module _ where

module
  SigmaPreserves {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{C : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}{D : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ}
    (e : (a : A) ‚Üí C a ‚âÉ D a)
  where

  private
    f : (a : A) ‚Üí C a ‚Üí D a
    f a = lemap (e a)

    f‚Åª¬π : (a : A) ‚Üí D a ‚Üí C a
    f‚Åª¬π a = remap (e a)

    Œ± : (a : A) ‚Üí (f a) ‚àò (f‚Åª¬π a) ‚àº id
    Œ± a x = lrmap-inverse (e a)

    Œ≤ : (a : A) ‚Üí (f‚Åª¬π a) ‚àò (f a) ‚àº id
    Œ≤ a x = rlmap-inverse (e a)

    Œ£AC-to-Œ£AD :  Œ£ A C ‚Üí Œ£ A D
    Œ£AC-to-Œ£AD (a , c) = (a , (f a) c)

    Œ£AD-to-Œ£AC :  Œ£ A D ‚Üí Œ£ A C
    Œ£AD-to-Œ£AC (a , d) = (a , (f‚Åª¬π a) d)

    H‚ÇÅ : Œ£AC-to-Œ£AD ‚àò Œ£AD-to-Œ£AC ‚àº id
    H‚ÇÅ (a , d) = pair= (idp , Œ± a d)

    H‚ÇÇ : Œ£AD-to-Œ£AC ‚àò Œ£AC-to-Œ£AD ‚àº id
    H‚ÇÇ (a , c) = pair= (idp , Œ≤ a c)




  -- Lem.
  sigma-preserves
    : Œ£ A C ‚âÉ Œ£ A D

  sigma-preserves = qinv-‚âÉ Œ£AC-to-Œ£AD (Œ£AD-to-Œ£AC , H‚ÇÅ , H‚ÇÇ)

open SigmaPreserves




If  and  and , then





module SigmaPreserves-‚âÉ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
  {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ} (e : B ‚âÉ A) {C : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ} where

  
  private
    f : B ‚Üí A
    f = lemap e

    ishaef : ishae f
    ishaef = ‚âÉ-ishae e

    f‚Åª¬π : A ‚Üí B
    f‚Åª¬π = ishae.g ishaef

    Œ± : f ‚àò f‚Åª¬π ‚àº id
    Œ± = ishae.Œµ ishaef

    Œ≤ : f‚Åª¬π ‚àò f  ‚àº id
    Œ≤ = ishae.Œ∑ ishaef

    œÑ : (b : B) ‚Üí ap f (Œ≤ b) == Œ± (f b)
    œÑ = ishae.œÑ ishaef

  Œ£AC-to-Œ£BCf : Œ£ A C ‚Üí Œ£ B (Œª b ‚Üí C (f b))
  Œ£AC-to-Œ£BCf (a , c) = f‚Åª¬π a , c'
    where
      c' : C (f (f‚Åª¬π a))
      c' = transport C ((Œ± a) ‚Åª¬π) c

  Œ£BCf-to-Œ£AC : Œ£ B (Œª b ‚Üí C (f b)) ‚Üí Œ£ A C
  Œ£BCf-to-Œ£AC (b , c') = f b , c'

  private
    H‚ÇÅ : Œ£AC-to-Œ£BCf ‚àò Œ£BCf-to-Œ£AC ‚àº id
    H‚ÇÅ (b , c') = pair= (Œ≤ b , patho)
      where
      c'' : C (f (f‚Åª¬π (f b)))
      c'' = transport C ((Œ± (f b)) ‚Åª¬π) c'

      -- patho : c'' == c' [ (C ‚àò f) ‚Üì (Œ≤ b)]
      patho : transport (Œª x ‚Üí C (f x)) (Œ≤ b) c'' == c'
      patho =
        begin
          transport (Œª x ‚Üí C (f x)) (Œ≤ b) c''
            ==‚ü® transport-family (Œ≤ b) c'' ‚ü©
          transport C (ap f (Œ≤ b)) c''
            ==‚ü® ap (Œª Œ≥ ‚Üí transport C Œ≥ c'') (œÑ b) ‚ü©
          transport C (Œ± (f b)) c''
            ==‚ü® transport-comp-h ((Œ± (f b)) ‚Åª¬π) (Œ± (f b)) c' ‚ü©
          transport C ( ((Œ± (f b)) ‚Åª¬π) ¬∑ Œ± (f b)) c'
            ==‚ü® ap (Œª Œ≥ ‚Üí transport C Œ≥ c') (¬∑-linv (Œ± (f b))) ‚ü©
          transport C idp c'
            ==‚ü®‚ü©
          c'
        ‚àé

  private
    H‚ÇÇ : Œ£BCf-to-Œ£AC ‚àò Œ£AC-to-Œ£BCf ‚àº id
    H‚ÇÇ (a , c) = pair= (Œ± a , patho)
      where
      patho : transport C (Œ± a) (transport C ((Œ± a) ‚Åª¬π) c) == c
      patho =
        begin
          transport C (Œ± a) (transport C ((Œ± a) ‚Åª¬π) c)
            ==‚ü® transport-comp-h (((Œ± a) ‚Åª¬π)) (Œ± a) c ‚ü©
          transport C ( ((Œ± a) ‚Åª¬π) ¬∑ (Œ± a) ) c
            ==‚ü® ap (Œª Œ≥ ‚Üí transport C Œ≥ c) (¬∑-linv (Œ± a)) ‚ü©
          transport C idp c
            ==‚ü®‚ü©
          c
        ‚àé




  -- Equivalence
  sigma-preserves-‚âÉ
    : Œ£ A C ‚âÉ Œ£ B (Œª b ‚Üí C (f b))

  sigma-preserves-‚âÉ = qinv-‚âÉ Œ£AC-to-Œ£BCf (Œ£BCf-to-Œ£AC , H‚ÇÅ , H‚ÇÇ)

open SigmaPreserves-‚âÉ public

sigma-maps-‚âÉ
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ ‚Ñì‚ÇÑ} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ} {A' : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÑ} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}{B' : A' ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
  ‚Üí (Œ± : A ‚âÉ A')
  ‚Üí ((a : A) ‚Üí (B a ‚âÉ B' ((Œ± ‚àô) a)))
  ‚Üí Œ£ A B ‚âÉ Œ£ A' B'

sigma-maps-‚âÉ {A = A}{A'}{B}{B'} Œ± Œ≤ =
  ‚âÉ-trans (sigma-preserves Œ≤) (‚âÉ-sym (sigma-preserves-‚âÉ Œ±))

Equivalence with Pi type



module PiPreserves {‚Ñì‚ÇÅ ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ} {A : Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÅ}{C : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÇ}{D : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚ÇÉ}
    (e : (a : A) ‚Üí (C a ‚âÉ D a)) where

  private
    f : (a : A) ‚Üí C a ‚Üí D a
    f a = lemap (e a)

    f‚Åª¬π : (a : A) ‚Üí D a ‚Üí C a
    f‚Åª¬π a = remap (e a)

    Œ± : (a : A) ‚Üí (f a) ‚àò (f‚Åª¬π a) ‚àº id
    Œ± a x = lrmap-inverse (e a)

    Œ≤ : (a : A) ‚Üí (f‚Åª¬π a) ‚àò (f a) ‚àº id
    Œ≤ a x = rlmap-inverse (e a)

    Œ†AC‚ÜíŒ†AD : Œ† A C ‚Üí Œ† A D
    Œ†AC‚ÜíŒ†AD p = Œª a ‚Üí (f a) (p a)

    Œ†AD‚ÜíŒ†AC : Œ† A D ‚Üí Œ† A C
    Œ†AD‚ÜíŒ†AC p = Œª a ‚Üí (f‚Åª¬π a) (p a)

    H‚ÇÅ : Œ†AC‚ÜíŒ†AD ‚àò Œ†AD‚ÜíŒ†AC ‚àº id
    H‚ÇÅ p =
      begin
        (Œ†AC‚ÜíŒ†AD ‚àò Œ†AD‚ÜíŒ†AC) p
          ==‚ü® idp ‚ü©
        Œ†AC‚ÜíŒ†AD (Œª a ‚Üí (f‚Åª¬π a) (p a))
          ==‚ü® idp ‚ü©
        (Œª aa ‚Üí (f aa) (f‚Åª¬π aa (p aa)))
          ==‚ü® funext (Œª x ‚Üí Œ± x (p x)) ‚ü©
        (Œª aa ‚Üí p aa)
      ‚àé

    H‚ÇÇ : Œ†AD‚ÜíŒ†AC ‚àò Œ†AC‚ÜíŒ†AD ‚àº id
    H‚ÇÇ p =
      begin
        (Œ†AD‚ÜíŒ†AC ‚àò Œ†AC‚ÜíŒ†AD) p
          ==‚ü® idp ‚ü©
        Œ†AD‚ÜíŒ†AC (Œª a ‚Üí (f a) (p a))
          ==‚ü® idp ‚ü©
        (Œª aa ‚Üí (f‚Åª¬π aa) (f aa (p aa)))
          ==‚ü® funext (Œª x ‚Üí Œ≤ x (p x)) ‚ü©
        (Œª aa ‚Üí p aa)
      ‚àé




  -- Lem.
  pi-equivalence
    : Œ† A C ‚âÉ Œ† A D -- by (e : (a : A) ‚Üí (C a ‚âÉ D a))

  pi-equivalence = qinv-‚âÉ Œ†AC‚ÜíŒ†AD (Œ†AD‚ÜíŒ†AC , H‚ÇÅ , H‚ÇÇ)

-- open PiPreserves public

Voevodsky‚Äôs Univalence Axiom



Voevodsky‚Äôs Univalence axiom is postulated. It induces an equality between any
two equivalent types. Some $Œ≤$ and $Œ∑$ rules are provided.



module UnivalenceAxiom {‚Ñì} {A B : Type ‚Ñì} where




  idtoeqv
    : A == B
    --------
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ B

  idtoeqv p =
    qinv-‚âÉ
      (coe p)
      ((!coe p) ,
        (coe-inv-l p , coe-inv-r p))




Synonyms:



  ==-to-‚âÉ = idtoeqv
  ‚â°-to-‚âÉ  = idtoeqv
  ite     = idtoeqv




The Univalence axiom induces an equivalence between equalities
and equivalences.



Univalence Axiom.



  postulate
    axiomUnivalence
      : isEquivalence ‚â°-to-‚âÉ




In Slide 20 from an Escardo‚Äôs talk, base on what we saw, we give
the following no standard definition of Univalence axiom (without transport).



  UA
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí (Type (lsuc ‚Ñì))

  UA {‚Ñì = ‚Ñì}  =
    (X : Type ‚Ñì) ‚Üí isProp ( ‚àë (Type ‚Ñì) (Œª Y ‚Üí (X ‚âÉ Y) ))
    where open import  HLevelTypes




About this Univalence axiom version:



    
  
  • 
    
    ‚àë (Type ‚Ñì) (Œª Y ‚Üí X ‚âÉ Y) is inhabited, but we don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs contractible
  unless, we demand (assume) to be propositional. Then, in such a case,
  we use the theorem (isProp P ‚âÉ (P ‚Üí isContr P)). To be more precise, we know it‚Äôs contractible, in fact, the center of contractibility, is indeed (X, id-‚âÉ X : X ‚âÉ X).
    
  
    • 
  
  • Univalence is a generalized extensionality axiom for intensional MLTT theory.
    • 
  
  • The type UA is a proposition.
    • 
  
  • UA is consistent with MLTT.
    • 
  
  • Theorem of MLTT+UA: $P(X)$ and $X‚âÉY$ imply $P(Y)$ for any $P : \mathsf{Type} ‚Üí \mathsf{Type}$.
    • 
  
  • Theorem of spartan MLTT with two universes. The univalence axiom formulated
with crude isomorphism rather than equivalence is false!.
    • 




  eqvUnivalence
    : (A == B) ‚âÉ (A ‚âÉ B)

  eqvUnivalence = idtoeqv , axiomUnivalence




Synonyms:


  ==-equiv-‚âÉ = eqvUnivalence
  ==-‚âÉ-‚âÉ     = eqvUnivalence
  ‚â°-‚âÉ-‚âÉ      = eqvUnivalence




Introduction rule for equalities:



  ua
    : A ‚âÉ B
    -------
    ‚Üí A == B

  ua = remap eqvUnivalence




Synonyms:



  ‚âÉ-to-==   = ua
  eqv-to-eq = ua




Computation rules



  ua-Œ≤
    : (Œ± : A ‚âÉ B)
    ----------------------
    ‚Üí idtoeqv (ua Œ±) == Œ±

  ua-Œ≤ eqv = lrmap-inverse eqvUnivalence




  ua-Œ∑
    : (p : A == B)
    ---------------------
    ‚Üí ua (idtoeqv p) == p

  ua-Œ∑ p = rlmap-inverse eqvUnivalence

Hlevel types



Higher levels of the homotopical structure:



    
  
  • Contractible types ($-2$)
    • 
  
  • Propositions ($-1$)
    • 
  
  • Sets ($0$)
    • 
  
  • Groupoids ($1$)
    • 




Contractible types



A contractible type is a type such that every
element is equal to a point, the center of contraction.



  
isContr
  : (A : Type ‚Ñì)
  --------------
  ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì

isContr A = Œ£ A (Œª a ‚Üí ((x : A) ‚Üí a == x))




Synonym:



Contractible = isContr
is-singleton = isContr
isSingleton  = isContr




If a type is contractible, any of its points is a center of contraction:



allAreCenter
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì} {A : Type ‚Ñì}
  ‚Üí (c‚ÇÅ : A) ‚Üí (f : (x : A) ‚Üí c‚ÇÅ == x)
  ‚Üí (‚àÄ (c‚ÇÇ : A) ‚Üí (‚àÄ (x : A) ‚Üí c‚ÇÇ == x))

allAreCenter c‚ÇÅ f c‚ÇÇ x = sym (f c‚ÇÇ) ¬∑ (f x)




Propositions



A type is a mere proposition if any two inhabitants of the type are equal.



isProp
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì} (A : Type ‚Ñì) ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì

isProp A = ((x y : A) ‚Üí x == y)




Synonyms:



is-subsingleton = isProp
isSubsingleton  = isProp
is-prop         = isProp




Let‚Äôs stop a bit. So, these propositios, also named ‚Äúmere‚Äù propositions
tell us: in a  proposition, its elements are connected with each other.
Subsinglenton (which is, subset of a singlenton (a unit point set)) is
empty or it has the element. Propositions can be seen as equivalent to ùüò or ùüô.



    
  
  • Contractible types ‚âÉ ùüô
    • 
  
  • Propositions ‚âÉ (ùüò if it‚Äôs not inhabited or ùüô if it‚Äôs inhabited)
    • 




Therefore, we will find a theorem later that says ‚Äúif A is a proposition,
and it‚Äôs inhabited then it‚Äôs contractible‚Äù, and it makes sense perfectly.



hProp
  : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì} ‚Üí Type (lsuc ‚Ñì)

hProp {‚Ñì} = ‚àë (Type ‚Ñì) isProp




Sets



A type is a set& by definition if any two equalities on the type are equal Sets
are types without any higher *dimensional structure,  all parallel paths are
homotopic and the homotopy is given by a continuous function on the two paths.



isSet
  : Type ‚Ñì ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì
isSet A = (x y : A) ‚Üí isProp (x == y)




Synonyms:



is-set = isSet




The type of sets



hSet
  : Type (lsuc ‚Ñì)

hSet {‚Ñì} = ‚àë (Type ‚Ñì) isSet




Groupoids



isGroupoid
  : Type ‚Ñì ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì

isGroupoid A  = (a‚ÇÄ a‚ÇÅ : A) ‚Üí isSet (a‚ÇÄ ‚â° a‚ÇÅ)




Synonyms:



is-groupoid = isGroupoid




Groupoid
  : Type (lsuc ‚Ñì)
Groupoid {‚Ñì} = ‚àë (Type ‚Ñì) isGroupoid

HLevel Lemmas

Proposition and Set lemmas



module HLevelLemmas where




For any type, ,





Contractible types are Propositions:


  contrIsProp
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí isContr A
    -----------
    ‚Üí isProp A

  contrIsProp (a , p) x y = ! (p x) ¬∑ p y

  -- Synonyms
  isContr‚ÜíisProp = contrIsProp




To be contractible is itself a proposition.



  contractible-from-inhabited-prop
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí A
    ‚Üí isProp A
    ----------------
    ‚Üí Contractible A

  contractible-from-inhabited-prop a p = (a , p a )




Propositions are Sets:



  propIsSet
    : ‚àÄ {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí isProp A
    ----------
    ‚Üí isSet A

  propIsSet {A = A} f a _ p q = lemma p ¬∑ inv (lemma q)
    where
      triang : {y z : A} {p : y == z} ‚Üí (f a y) ¬∑ p == f a z
      triang {y}{p = idp} = inv (¬∑-runit (f a y))

      lemma : {y z : A} (p : y == z) ‚Üí p == ! (f a y) ¬∑ (f a z)
      lemma {y = y}{w} p =
        begin
          p                       ==‚ü® ap (_¬∑ p) (inv (¬∑-linv (f a y))) ‚ü©
          ! (f a y) ¬∑ f a y ¬∑ p   ==‚ü® ¬∑-assoc (! (f a y)) (f a y) p ‚ü©
          ! (f a y) ¬∑ (f a y ¬∑ p) ==‚ü® ap (! (f a y) ¬∑_) triang ‚ü©
          ! (f a y) ¬∑ (f a w)
        ‚àé




Synonyms:


  prop-is-set  = propIsSet
  prop‚Üíset     = propIsSet
  isProp-isSet = propIsSet
  Prop-is-Set  = propIsSet




Propositions are Sets:


  Set-is-Groupoid
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí isSet A
    ----------
    ‚Üí isGroupoid A

  Set-is-Groupoid {A} A-is-set = Œª x y ‚Üí prop-is-set (A-is-set x y)




Examples of propositions:



  ‚ä•-is-prop
    : isProp {lzero} ‚ä•
  ‚ä•-is-prop x ()

  ùüô-is-prop
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì} ‚Üí isProp (ùüô {‚Ñì})
  ùüô-is-prop unit .unit = idp





  is-prop-A+B
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí isProp A
    ‚Üí isProp B
    ‚Üí ¬¨ (A √ó B)
    ----------------
    ‚Üí isProp (A + B)

  is-prop-A+B ispropA ispropB ¬¨A√óB (inl x) (inl x‚ÇÅ) = ap inl (ispropA x x‚ÇÅ)
  is-prop-A+B ispropA ispropB ¬¨A√óB (inl x) (inr x‚ÇÅ) = ‚ä•-elim (¬¨A√óB ( x , x‚ÇÅ))
  is-prop-A+B ispropA ispropB ¬¨A√óB (inr x) (inl x‚ÇÅ) = ‚ä•-elim (¬¨A√óB (x‚ÇÅ , x))
  is-prop-A+B ispropA ispropB ¬¨A√óB (inr x) (inr x‚ÇÅ) = ap inr (ispropB x x‚ÇÅ)




Propositions are propositions. This time, please notice
the strong use of function extensionality, used twice here.



  propIsProp
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    -- (funext : Function-Extensionality)
    -------------------------------------
    ‚Üí isProp (isProp A)

  propIsProp {_}{A} =
    Œª x y ‚Üí funext (Œª a ‚Üí
              funext (Œª b
                ‚Üí propIsSet x a b (x a b) (y a b)))




  prop-is-prop-always = propIsProp
  prop-is-prop        = propIsProp
  prop‚Üíprop           = propIsProp
  isProp-isProp       = propIsProp
  is-prop-is-prop     = propIsProp




The dependent function type to proposition types is itself a
proposition.



  isProp-pi
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    -- (funext : Function-Extensionality)
    ‚Üí ((a : A) ‚Üí isProp (B a))
    --------------------------
    ‚Üí isProp ((a : A) ‚Üí B a)

  isProp-pi props f g = funext Œª a ‚Üí props a (f a) (g a)




  pi-is-prop = isProp-pi
  Œ†-isProp   = isProp-pi
  piIsProp   = isProp-pi




Propositional extensionality, here stated as prop-ext,
is a consequence of univalence axiom.



  prop-ext
    : {A B : Type ‚Ñì}
    -- (ua : Univalence Axiom)
    ‚Üí isProp A
    ‚Üí isProp B
    ‚Üí (A ‚áî B)
    -----------
    ‚Üí A == B

  prop-ext propA propB (f , g) =
    ua (qinv-‚âÉ f (g , (Œª x ‚Üí propB _ _) , (Œª x ‚Üí propA _ _)))




Synomyms:



  props-‚áî-to-== = prop-ext
  ispropA-B     = prop-ext
  propositional-extensionality = prop-ext




  setIsProp
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    -----------------
    ‚Üí isProp (isSet A)

  setIsProp {‚Ñì} {A} p‚ÇÅ p‚ÇÇ =
    funext (Œª x ‚Üí
      funext (Œª y ‚Üí
        funext (Œª p ‚Üí
          funext (Œª q ‚Üí propIsSet (p‚ÇÇ x y) p q (p‚ÇÅ x y p q) (p‚ÇÇ x y p q)))))



  set-is-prop = setIsProp
  set‚Üíprop    = setIsProp




The product of propositions is itself a proposition.



  isProp-prod
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí isProp A
    ‚Üí isProp B
    ---------------------
    ‚Üí isProp (A √ó B)

  isProp-prod p q x y = prodByComponents ((p _ _) , (q _ _))




  √ó-is-prop      = isProp-prod
  ispropA√óB      = isProp-prod
  √ó-isProp       = isProp-prod
  prop√óprop‚Üíprop = isProp-prod




  isSet-prod
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} ‚Üí {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí isSet A ‚Üí isSet B
    -------------------
    ‚Üí isSet (A √ó B)

  isSet-prod sa sb (a , b) (c , d) p q = begin
     p
      ==‚ü® inv (prodByCompInverse p) ‚ü©
     prodByComponents (prodComponentwise p)
      ==‚ü® ap prodByComponents (prodByComponents (sa a c _ _ , sb b d _ _)) ‚ü©
     prodByComponents (prodComponentwise q)
      ==‚ü® prodByCompInverse q ‚ü©
     q
    ‚àé



Synomys:



  √ó-is-set      = isSet-prod
  isSetA√óB      = isSet-prod
  √ó-isSet       = isSet-prod
  set√óset‚Üíset   = isSet-prod




  Prop-/-‚â°
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}
    ‚Üí (P : A ‚Üí hProp {‚Ñì·µ¢})
    ‚Üí ‚àÄ {a‚ÇÄ a‚ÇÅ} p‚ÇÄ p‚ÇÅ {Œ± : a‚ÇÄ ‚â° a‚ÇÅ}
    ------------------------------
    ‚Üí p‚ÇÄ ‚â° p‚ÇÅ [ (# ‚àò P) / Œ± ]

  Prop-/-‚â° P {a‚ÇÄ} p‚ÇÄ p‚ÇÅ {Œ± = idp} = proj‚ÇÇ (P a‚ÇÄ) p‚ÇÄ p‚ÇÅ




H-levels actually are preserved by products, coproducts, pi-types and sigma-types.



  postulate
    +-of-sets-is-set
      : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
      ‚Üí isSet A
      ‚Üí isSet B
      ---------------
      ‚Üí isSet (A + B)
  {-
      The idea here is to have an iso between:
      A + B ‚âÉ ‚àë ùüö P where P : (tt ‚Ü¶ A, ff ‚Ü¶ B)

        f : A + B ‚Üí ‚àë ùüö P
           (left a) ‚Ü¶ (t , A)
  -}

  -- +-of-sets-is-set {‚Ñì·µ¢} {‚Ñì‚±º} {A} {B} issetA issetB x y p q = {!!}
  --   where
  --   f : (A + B) ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)
  --   f (inl a) = ‚Üë ‚Ñì‚±º  A
  --   f (inr b) = ‚Üë ‚Ñì·µ¢ B
  --
  --   aux
  --     : (a : A + B) ‚Üí f a
  --   aux (inl a) = Lift a
  --   aux (inr b) = Lift b
  --
  --   aux2 : (A + B) ‚Üí {!!}
  --   aux2 w
  --     with aux w
  --   ... | e = {!e!}




  postulate -- Ex. 3.3
    isSet-Œ£
      : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} ‚Üí {B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
      ‚Üí isSet A ‚Üí ((a : A) ‚Üí  isSet (B a))
      -------------------
      ‚Üí isSet (Œ£ A B)

  sigma-is-set = isSet-Œ£
  -- isSet-Œ£ sa sb (a , b) (c , d) p q = {!   !}




  postulate
   is-set-equiv-to-set
    : {A B : Type  ‚Ñì·µ¢}
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ B
    ‚Üí isSet A
    ---------
    ‚Üí isSet B




  id-contractible-from-set
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí isSet A
    ‚Üí {a a' : A}
    ‚Üí a ‚â° a' ‚Üí isContr (a ‚â° a')

  id-contractible-from-set iA {a}{.a} idp
    = idp , Œª q ‚Üí iA a a idp q
  -- This is quite obvious from the hset definition.
  -- But it's nice to spell it out fully.

   ‚â°-is-set-from-sets
