    ‚Üí isSet B
    ‚Üí A ‚â° B

 --  ‚â°-is-set-from-sets iA iB = {!!}




Lemma 3.11.3: For any type A, isContr A is a mere proposition.



  isContrIsProp
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    --------------------
    ‚Üí isProp (isContr A)

  isContrIsProp {_} {A} (a , p) (b , q) =
    Œ£-bycomponents (inv (q a) , isProp-pi (AisSet b) _ q)
      where
        AisSet : isSet A
        AisSet = propIsSet (contrIsProp (a , p))

  BookLemma3113 = isContrIsProp




Lemma 3.3.3 (HoTT-Book):


  lemma333
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí isProp A
    ‚Üí isProp B
    ‚Üí (A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí (B ‚Üí A)
    ----------
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ B

  lemma333 iA iB f g = qinv-‚âÉ f (g , gf , fg)
    where
    private
      fg : (f :> g) ‚àº id
      fg a = iA ((f :> g) a) a

      gf : (g :> f) ‚àº id
      gf b = iB ((g :> f) b) b

  BookLemma333 = lemma333




Lemma 3.3.2 (HoTT-Book):


  prop-inhabited-‚âÉùüô
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí isProp A
    ‚Üí (a : A)
    ---------
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ (ùüô {‚Ñì})
  prop-inhabited-‚âÉùüô iA a =
    lemma333 iA ùüô-is-prop (Œª _ ‚Üí unit) (Œª _ ‚Üí a)

  BookLemma332 = prop-inhabited-‚âÉùüô




From Exercise 3.5 (HoTT-Book):


  isProp-‚âÉ-isContr
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí isProp A ‚âÉ (A ‚Üí isContr A)

  isProp-‚âÉ-isContr {A = A} =
    lemma333 isProp-isProp (pi-is-prop (Œª a ‚Üí isContrIsProp)) go back
    where
      private
        go : isProp A ‚Üí (A ‚Üí isContr A)
        go iA a = a , Œª a' ‚Üí iA a a'

        back : (A ‚Üí isContr A) ‚Üí isProp A
        back f = Œª a a' ‚Üí (! œÄ‚ÇÇ (f a) a) ¬∑ (œÄ‚ÇÇ (f a) a')




Equivalence of two types is a proposition
Moreover, equivalences preserve propositions.



Contractible maps are propositions:



  isContrMapIsProp
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
    -------------
    ‚Üí isProp (isContrMap f)

  isContrMapIsProp f = pi-is-prop (Œª a ‚Üí isContrIsProp)




  isEquivIsProp
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí isProp (isEquiv f)

  isEquivIsProp = isContrMapIsProp




Equality of same-morphism equivalences


  sameEqv
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí {Œ± Œ≤ : A ‚âÉ B}
    ‚Üí œÄ‚ÇÅ Œ± == œÄ‚ÇÅ Œ≤
    ‚Üí    Œ± == Œ≤

  sameEqv {Œ± = (f , œÉ)} {(g , œÑ)} p = Œ£-bycomponents (p , (isEquivIsProp g _ œÑ))




  equiv-iff-hprop
    : {A B : Type  ‚Ñì·µ¢}
    ‚Üí isProp A
    ‚Üí isProp B
    -----------------
    ‚Üí isProp (A ‚âÉ B)

  equiv-iff-hprop {A = A}{B} iA iB ef eg
    = sameEqv f‚â°g
    where
    private
      f‚â°g : (œÄ‚ÇÅ ef) ‚â° (œÄ‚ÇÅ eg)
      f‚â°g = pi-is-prop (Œª _ ‚Üí iB) (œÄ‚ÇÅ ef) (œÄ‚ÇÅ eg)




  propEqvIsprop
    : {A B : Type  ‚Ñì·µ¢}
    ‚Üí isProp A
    ‚Üí isProp B
    -----------------
    ‚Üí isProp (A == B)

  propEqvIsprop iA iB p q =
    begin
      p
        ‚â°‚ü® ! (ua-Œ∑ p) ‚ü©
      ua (idtoeqv p)
        ‚â°‚ü® ap ua (equiv-iff-hprop iA iB (idtoeqv p) (idtoeqv q)) ‚ü©
      ua (idtoeqv q)
        ‚â°‚ü® ua-Œ∑ q ‚ü©
      q
     ‚àé




Equivalences preserve propositions



  isProp-‚âÉ
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (A ‚âÉ B)
    ‚Üí isProp A
    ----------
    ‚Üí isProp B

  isProp-‚âÉ eq prop x y =
    begin
      x                       ==‚ü® inv (lrmap-inverse eq) ‚ü©
      lemap eq ((remap eq) x) ==‚ü® ap (Œª u ‚Üí lemap eq u) (prop _ _) ‚ü©
      lemap eq ((remap eq) y) ==‚ü® lrmap-inverse eq ‚ü©
      y
    ‚àé




  ‚âÉ-trans-inv
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì} {A B : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí (Œ± : A ‚âÉ B)
    -----------------------------
    ‚Üí ‚âÉ-trans Œ± (‚âÉ-flip Œ±) == A‚âÉA

  ‚âÉ-trans-inv Œ± = sameEqv (
    begin
      œÄ‚ÇÅ (‚âÉ-trans Œ± (‚âÉ-sym Œ±)) ==‚ü® refl _ ‚ü©
      œÄ‚ÇÅ (‚âÉ-sym Œ±) ‚àò œÄ‚ÇÅ Œ±     ==‚ü® funext (rlmap-inverse-h Œ±) ‚ü©
      id
    ‚àé)




The following lemma is telling us, something we should probably knew already:
Equivalence of propositions is the same logical equivalence.



  twoprops-to-equiv-‚âÉ-‚áî
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí isProp A
    ‚Üí isProp B
    -------------------
    ‚Üí (A ‚âÉ B) ‚âÉ (A ‚áî B)

  twoprops-to-equiv-‚âÉ-‚áî {A = A} {B} ispropA ispropB  = qinv-‚âÉ f (g , H‚ÇÅ , H‚ÇÇ)
   where
    f : (A ‚âÉ B) ‚Üí (A ‚áî B)
    f e = e ‚àô‚Üí , e ‚àô‚Üê

    g : (A ‚áî B) ‚Üí (A ‚âÉ B)
    g (h‚Üí , h‚Üê) = qinv-‚âÉ h‚Üí (h‚Üê , (Œª b ‚Üí ispropB (h‚Üí (h‚Üê b)) b) , (Œª a ‚Üí ispropA (h‚Üê (h‚Üí a)) a))

    H‚ÇÅ : f ‚àò g ‚àº id
    H‚ÇÅ (h‚Üí , h‚Üê) = idp

    H‚ÇÇ : g ‚àò f ‚àº id
    H‚ÇÇ e =
      begin
        g (e ‚àô‚Üí , e ‚àô‚Üê)
          ==‚ü®‚ü©
        e ‚àô‚Üí , _
          ==‚ü® Œ£-bycomponents (idp , isEquivIsProp (e ‚àô‚Üí) _ _) ‚ü©
        e
      ‚àé




FIXME : Put this somewhere else



  ‚àë-prop
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí isProp A
    ‚Üí ((a : A) ‚Üí isProp (B a))
    ------------------------
    ‚Üí isProp (‚àë A B)

  ‚àë-prop {B = B} iA Œª-iB u v
    = pair= (Œ± , Œ≤)
    where
      Œ± : œÄ‚ÇÅ u ‚â° œÄ‚ÇÅ v
      Œ± = iA (œÄ‚ÇÅ u) (œÄ‚ÇÅ v)

      Œ≤ : (œÄ‚ÇÇ u) ‚â° (œÄ‚ÇÇ v) [ B / Œ± ]
      Œ≤ = Œª-iB (œÄ‚ÇÅ v) (tr B Œ± (œÄ‚ÇÇ u)) (œÄ‚ÇÇ v)




  postulate
   ‚àè-set
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (iA : isSet A)
    ‚Üí ((a : A) ‚Üí isSet (B a))
    ‚Üí isSet (‚àè A B)




The following was a custom version useful to deal with functions
with implicit parameters.



  pi-is-prop-implicit
     : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
     ‚Üí ((a : A) ‚Üí isProp (B a))
     --------------------------
     ‚Üí isProp ({a : A} ‚Üí B a)

  pi-is-prop-implicit {A = A} {B} f = isProp-‚âÉ explicit-‚âÉ-implicit (pi-is-prop f)
    where
     explicit-‚âÉ-implicit
       : ((a : A) ‚Üí B a) ‚âÉ ({a : A} ‚Üí B a)
     explicit-‚âÉ-implicit = qinv-‚âÉ go ((Œª x x‚ÇÅ ‚Üí x) , (Œª x ‚Üí idp) , (Œª x ‚Üí idp))
       where
         go : ((a : A) ‚Üí B a) ‚Üí ({a : A} ‚Üí B a)
         go f {a} = f a




open HLevelLemmas public




postulate
  law-excluded-middle
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì} {P : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí isProp P
    ------------
    ‚Üí P + (¬¨ P)

LEM = law-excluded-middle




and the more general propositions-as-types formulation of the
law of excluded middle is:



postulate
 LEM‚àû
   : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
   ‚Üí A + (¬¨ A)




law-double-negation
 : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì} {P : Type ‚Ñì}
 ‚Üí isProp P
 -----------
 ‚Üí (¬¨ (¬¨ P)) ‚Üí P

law-double-negation iP with LEM iP
law-double-negation iP | inl x = Œª _ ‚Üí x
law-double-negation iP | inr x = Œª p‚Üí‚ä•‚Üí‚ä• ‚Üí ‚ä•-elim (p‚Üí‚ä•‚Üí‚ä• x) 




Law excluded middle and law of double negation are both equivalent.



Weak extensionality principle:


WeakExtensionalityPrinciple
  : {A : Type ‚Ñì} {P : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì}
  ‚Üí ((x : A) ‚Üí isContr (P x))
  -------------------------
  ‚Üí isContr ( ‚àè A P )

WeakExtensionalityPrinciple {A = A}{P} f =
  (fx , Œª h ‚Üí  ! funext (Œª x ‚Üí ! (œÄ‚ÇÇ (f x)) (h x)))
  where
   fx : ‚àè A P
   fx = Œª x ‚Üí œÄ‚ÇÅ (f x)

Types of Morphisms



module TypesofMorphisms where




Surjections



  isSurjection
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)

  isSurjection {B = B} f = (b : B) ‚Üí ‚à• fib f b ‚à•

  isSurjective = isSurjection
  isOnto       = isSurjection




Do not confuse with the traditional logic notation
for surjective functions which says $f$ is surjective if
$‚àÄ (b : B) ‚àÉ (a : A) . f a ‚â° b$. This is stronger than merely
know exists an $(a : A)$ as it was stated above with ‚à• fib f b ‚à•.



Therefore, we define the concept of split-surjection:



  isSplitSurjection
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)

  isSplitSurjection {B = B} f = (b  : B) ‚Üí fib f b




Which is equivalent to say $f$ is a retraction:



  isRetraction
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)

  isRetraction {A = A}{B} f =
    ‚àë (B ‚Üí A) (Œª g ‚Üí (b : B) ‚Üí f (g b) ‚â° b)




Embeddings



  isEmbedding
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ---------------
    ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)

  isEmbedding {A = A} f =
    ‚àÄ {x y : A} ‚Üí isEquiv (ap f {x}{y})




Injections



TODO: Should I demand for injective functions have their domains and codomains as sets?



  isInjective
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)

  isInjective {A = A} f = ‚àÄ {x y} ‚Üí f x ‚â° f y ‚Üí x ‚â° y




  isInjectiveIsProp
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (iA : isSet A)
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ------------------------
    ‚Üí isProp (isInjective f)
    
  isInjectiveIsProp {A = A}{B} iA f i1 i2 =
    aux i1 i2
    where
      private
        aux : isProp (‚àÄ {x y} ‚Üí (f x ‚â° f y ‚Üí x ‚â° y))
        aux = pi-is-prop-implicit
               (Œª x ‚Üí pi-is-prop-implicit (Œª y ‚Üí
                 pi-is-prop (Œª p ‚Üí iA x y)
               ))




  isSurjectionIsProp
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí isProp (isSurjection f)
  isSurjectionIsProp f = pi-is-prop (Œª b ‚Üí truncated-is-prop {A = fib f b})




If the function $f : A ‚Üí B$ is a surjection, we are able to get
a function $g : B ‚Üí A$ by the recursion principle of truncation.



  fromSurjection
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí isSet B
    ‚Üí isSurjection f
    ‚Üí isInjective f
    --------------------------------
    ‚Üí (b : B) ‚Üí ‚àë A (Œª a ‚Üí f a == b)

  fromSurjection {A = A}{B} f iB f-is-onto f-is-injective b
    = trunc-rec (aux b) id (f-is-onto b)
    where
    private
      aux
        : (b : B)
        ‚Üí isProp (fib f b)

      aux .(f x) (x , idp) (x' , p2) =
        ‚àë-‚â°
          (Œª y ‚Üí f y == f x)
          (f-is-injective (! p2))
          (iB (f x') (f x)
              (tr (Œª z‚ÇÅ ‚Üí f z‚ÇÅ == f x) (f-is-injective (! p2)) idp) p2)




Bijections



  isBijection
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí isSet A
    ‚Üí isSet B
    ---------------
    ‚Üí Type (‚Ñì·µ¢ ‚äî ‚Ñì‚±º)

  isBijection f iA iB = isInjective f √ó isSurjection f




  Bijection
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí {iA : isSet A}
    ‚Üí {iB : isSet B}
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí isBijection f iA iB
    ----------------------
    ‚Üí A ‚âÉ B

  Bijection {A = A}{B} {iA}{iB} f (f-is-injective , f-is-onto)
    = qinv-‚âÉ f (g , (H‚ÇÅ , H‚ÇÇ))
    where
    aux : (b : B) ‚Üí ‚àë A (Œª a ‚Üí f a ‚â° b)
    aux = fromSurjection f iB f-is-onto f-is-injective

    g : B ‚Üí A
    g = œÄ‚ÇÅ ‚àò aux

    H‚ÇÅ : (b : B) ‚Üí f (g b) == b
    H‚ÇÅ b = œÄ‚ÇÇ (aux b)

    H‚ÇÇ : (a : A) ‚Üí g (f a) == a
    H‚ÇÇ a = f-is-injective (H‚ÇÅ (f a))




  ‚âÉ-to-bijection
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (iA : isSet A)
    ‚Üí (iB : isSet B)
    -----------------------------------------
    ‚Üí (e : A ‚âÉ B) ‚Üí (isBijection (e ‚àô‚Üí) iA iB)

  ‚âÉ-to-bijection iA iB e =
    (Œª {x y} p  ‚Üí ! (‚àô‚Üê‚àò‚àô‚Üí e) ¬∑ (ap (e ‚àô‚Üê) p)  ¬∑ (‚àô‚Üê‚àò‚àô‚Üí e) )  -- is injective
    , Œª b ‚Üí ‚à£ (e ‚àô‚Üê) b , ‚àô‚Üí‚àò‚àô‚Üê e ‚à£                            -- is surjective
    where open import EquivalenceType
 



Bijection and being equivalent are equivalent notions:



  bij-‚âÉ-‚âÉ
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (iA : isSet A) (iB : isSet B)
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ----------------------------------
    ‚Üí isBijection f iA iB  ‚âÉ isEquiv f
    
  bij-‚âÉ-‚âÉ {A = A}{B} iA iB f =
    qinv-‚âÉ
      (Œª bij ‚Üí œÄ‚ÇÇ (Bijection {iA = iA}{iB} f bij))
      ((Œª isEquivf ‚Üí ‚âÉ-to-bijection iA iB (f , isEquivf))
      , h1 , h2)
    where
      h1 : (Œª x ‚Üí œÄ‚ÇÇ (Bijection {iA = iA}{iB} f (‚âÉ-to-bijection iA iB (f , x)))) ‚àº id
      h1 e = isContrMapIsProp f _ e

      h2 : (Œª x ‚Üí ‚âÉ-to-bijection iA iB (f , œÄ‚ÇÇ (Bijection {iA = iA}{iB} f x))) ‚àº id
      h2 bij = √ó-is-prop (isInjectiveIsProp iA f) (isSurjectionIsProp f) _ bij

  open import QuasiinverseLemmas




  bijIsProp
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (iA : isSet A)(iB : isSet B)
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ------------------------------
    ‚Üí isProp (isBijection f iA iB)

  bijIsProp iA iB f  = isProp-‚âÉ (‚âÉ-sym (bij-‚âÉ-‚âÉ iA iB f)) (isEquivIsProp f)
  bijection-is-prop = bijIsProp




For some reasons, we might need to have the inverse, the actual function, of a bijection.
One way I see now is to recover such a function from the equivalence, using remap. Let‚Äôs see this:



  inverse-of-bijection
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{B : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}
    ‚Üí {iA : isSet A}{iB : isSet B}
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí isBijection f iA iB
    ------------------------------
    ‚Üí B ‚Üí A
  inverse-of-bijection {iA = iA}{iB} f isBij = remap (Bijection {iA = iA}{iB}f isBij)

  inv-of-bij = inverse-of-bijection

{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}
open import TransportLemmas
open import EquivalenceType
open import HLevelTypes
open import RelationType
open import FunExtAxiom
open import FunExtTransport

module
  HedbergLemmas
  where






  module
    HedbergLemmas2 (A : Type ‚Ñì)
    where




A set is a type satisfiying Axiom K.


    axiomKisSet
      : ((a : A) ‚Üí (p : a == a) ‚Üí p == refl a)
      ‚Üí isSet A

    axiomKisSet k x _ p idp = k x p




    reflRelIsSet
      : (r : Rel A)
      ‚Üí ((x y : A) ‚Üí R  x y ‚Üí x == y)  -- xRy ‚áí Id(x,y)
      ‚Üí   ((x : A) ‚Üí R  x x)           -- ‚àÄ x ‚áí xRx
      ------------------------------------
      ‚Üí isSet A

    reflRelIsSet r f œÅ x .x p idp = lemma p
      where
      lemma2
        : {a : A}
        ‚Üí (p : a == a) ‚Üí (o : R  a a)
        ‚Üí (f a a o) == f a a (transport (R  a) p o)
                     [ (Œª x ‚Üí a == x) ‚Üì p ]
                     
      lemma2 {a} p = funext-transport-l p (f a a) (f a a) (apd (f a) p)

      lemma3
        : {a : A}
        ‚Üí (p : a == a)
        ‚Üí (f a a (œÅ a)) ¬∑ p == (f a a (œÅ a))

      lemma3 {a} p = inv (transport-concat-r p _) ¬∑ lemma2 p (œÅ a) ¬∑
                       ap (f a a) (Rprop  a a _ (œÅ a))

      lemma
        : {a : A}
        ‚Üí (p : a == a)
        ‚Üí p == refl a
        
      lemma {a} p = ¬∑-cancellation ((f a a (œÅ a))) p (lemma3 p)




Lema: if a type is decidable, then ¬¨¬¨A is actually A.



    lemDoubleNeg
      : (A + ¬¨ A)
      ---------------
      ‚Üí (¬¨ (¬¨ A) ‚Üí A)

    lemDoubleNeg (inl x) _ = x
    lemDoubleNeg (inr f) n = exfalso (n f)
  open HedbergLemmas2 public




    
  
  • Hedberg‚Äôs theorem. A type with decidable equality is a set.
    • 




  hedberg
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí ((a b : A) ‚Üí (a == b) + ¬¨ (a == b))
    -------------------------------------
    ‚Üí isSet A

  hedberg {A = A} f
    = reflRelIsSet A
        (record { R = Œª a b ‚Üí ¬¨ (¬¨ (a == b))
                ; Rprop = isPropNeg })
                doubleNegEq (Œª a z ‚Üí z (refl a))

    where
    doubleNegEq
     : (a b : A) ‚Üí ¬¨ (¬¨ (a == b))
     ‚Üí (a == b)

    doubleNegEq a b = lemDoubleNeg (a == b) (f a b)

    isPropNeg
      : (a b : A)
      ‚Üí isProp (¬¨ (¬¨ (a == b)))

    isPropNeg a b x y = funext Œª u ‚Üí exfalso (x u)

Transport and Univalence



module UnivalenceTransport where




  transport-family-ap
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí (B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì)
    ‚Üí {x y : A}
    ‚Üí (p : x == y)
    ‚Üí (u : B x)
    ---------------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí transport B p u == transport (Œª X ‚Üí X) (ap B p) u

  transport-family-ap B idp u = idp




  transport-family-idtoeqv
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí (B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì)
    ‚Üí {x y : A}
    ‚Üí (p : x == y)
    ‚Üí (u : B x)
    ----------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí transport B p u == fun‚âÉ (idtoeqv (ap B p)) u

  transport-family-idtoeqv B idp u = idp




  transport-ua
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí (B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì)
    ‚Üí {x y : A}
    ‚Üí (p : x == y)
    ‚Üí (e : B x ‚âÉ B y)
    ‚Üí ap B p == ua e
    -----------------
    ‚Üí (u : B x) ‚Üí transport B p u == (fun‚âÉ e) u

  transport-ua B idp e q u =
    begin
      transport B idp u
        ==‚ü® transport-family-idtoeqv B idp u ‚ü©
      fun‚âÉ (idtoeqv (ap B idp)) u
        ==‚ü® ap (Œª r ‚Üí fun‚âÉ (idtoeqv r) u) q ‚ü©
      fun‚âÉ (idtoeqv (ua e)) u
        ==‚ü® ap (Œª r ‚Üí fun‚âÉ r u) (ua-Œ≤ e) ‚ü©
      fun‚âÉ e u
    ‚àé




  funext-transport-ua
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí (B : A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì)
    ‚Üí {x y : A}
    ‚Üí (p : x == y)
    ‚Üí (e : B x ‚âÉ B y)
    ‚Üí ap B p == ua e
    -----------------
    ‚Üí transport B p == (fun‚âÉ e)

  funext-transport-ua B p e x‚ÇÅ = funext (transport-ua B p e x‚ÇÅ)




  coe-ua
    : {A B : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí (Œ± : A ‚âÉ B)
    -------------------------------------
    ‚Üí (‚àÄ x ‚Üí (coe (ua Œ±) x) == ((Œ± ‚àô) x))

  coe-ua Œ± = happly (ap (lemap) (ua-Œ≤ Œ±))




  coe-ua-¬∑ 
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì} {A B C : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí (Œ± : A ‚âÉ B)
    ‚Üí (Œ≤ : B ‚âÉ C)
    --------------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí coe (ua Œ± ¬∑ ua Œ≤) ‚â° ((coe (ua Œ±)) :> coe (ua Œ≤))

  coe-ua-¬∑ Œ± Œ≤ =
    begin
      coe (ua Œ± ¬∑ ua Œ≤)
       ‚â°‚ü®‚ü© 
      tr (Œª X ‚Üí X) (ua Œ± ¬∑ ua Œ≤)
       ‚â°‚ü® ! (transport-comp (ua Œ±) (ua Œ≤)) ‚ü©
      (tr (Œª X ‚Üí X) (ua Œ±)) :> (tr (Œª X ‚Üí X) (ua Œ≤))
        ‚â°‚ü® idp ‚ü©
     ((coe (ua Œ±)) :> coe (ua Œ≤))
    ‚àé




In addition, we can state a similar result with idtoequiv:



  idtoequiv-ua-¬∑
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì} {A B C : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí (Œ± : A ‚âÉ B)
    ‚Üí (Œ≤ : B ‚âÉ C)
    ---------------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí ite (ua Œ± ¬∑ ua Œ≤) ‚â° ((ite (ua Œ±)) ‚àò‚âÉ (ite (ua Œ≤)))

  idtoequiv-ua-¬∑ Œ± Œ≤ = sameEqv (coe-ua-¬∑ Œ± Œ≤)
    where open import HLevelLemmas
    
  ite-ua-¬∑ = idtoequiv-ua-¬∑




  postulate
   ‚àò‚âÉ-ite-ua
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì} {A B C : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí (Œ± : A ‚âÉ B)
    ‚Üí (Œ≤ : B ‚âÉ C)
    ‚Üí (Œ± ‚àò‚âÉ Œ≤) ‚â° ite (ua Œ± ¬∑ ua Œ≤)

  {- lemma Œ± Œ≤ =
        begin
          (Œ± ‚àò‚âÉ Œ≤)
            ‚â°‚ü® ap‚ÇÇ (Œª x y ‚Üí x ‚àò‚âÉ y) (! (ua-Œ≤ Œ±)) (! (ua-Œ≤ Œ≤)) ‚ü©
          (ite (ua Œ±)) ‚àò‚âÉ (ite (ua Œ≤))
            ‚â°‚ü® ! (ite-ua-¬∑ Œ± Œ≤) ‚ü©
          ite (ua Œ± ¬∑ ua Œ≤)
  -}

Univalence Lemma for id Equivalence



module UnivalenceIdEquiv where




The identity equivalence creates the trivial path.



  ua-id
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    --------------------
    ‚Üí ua idEqv ‚â° refl A

  ua-id {A = A} =
    begin
      ua idEqv
        ‚â°‚ü® ap ua (sameEqv (refl id)) ‚ü©
      ua (idtoeqv (refl A))
        ‚â°‚ü® ua-Œ∑ (refl A) ‚ü©
      refl A
    ‚àé

Univalence lemmas



module UnivalenceComposition where




  ua-comp
    : {A B C : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí (Œ± : A ‚âÉ B)
    ‚Üí (Œ≤ : B ‚âÉ C)
    ---------------------------------
    ‚Üí ua (Œ± ‚àò‚âÉ Œ≤) == (ua Œ±) ¬∑ (ua Œ≤)

  ua-comp Œ± Œ≤  =
   begin
     ua (Œ± ‚àò‚âÉ Œ≤)
       ‚â°‚ü® ap ua (‚àò‚âÉ-ite-ua Œ± Œ≤) ‚ü©
     ua (ite (ua Œ± ¬∑ ua Œ≤))
       ‚â°‚ü® ua-Œ∑ ((ua Œ±) ¬∑ (ua Œ≤)) ‚ü©
     (ua Œ±) ¬∑ (ua Œ≤)
   ‚àé




Inverses are preserved (Type-check this takes ~30min)



  postulate
   ua-inv-r
    : {A B : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí (Œ± : A ‚âÉ B)
    -------------------------------
    ‚Üí ua Œ± ¬∑ ua (‚âÉ-sym Œ±) == refl A

  {-
  ua-inv-r {A = A} Œ± =
    begin
      ua Œ± ¬∑ ua (‚âÉ-sym Œ±)
        ==‚ü® ! (ua-comp Œ± (‚âÉ-sym Œ±)) ‚ü©
      ua (‚âÉ-trans Œ± (‚âÉ-sym Œ±))
        ==‚ü® ap ua (‚âÉ-trans-inv Œ±) ‚ü©
      ua idEqv
        ==‚ü® UnivalenceLemmas.ua-id ‚ü©
      refl A
    ‚àé
  -}




  ua-inv
    : {A B : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí (Œ± : A ‚âÉ B)
    -------------------------
    ‚Üí ua (‚âÉ-sym Œ±) ‚â° ! (ua Œ±)

  ua-inv Œ± =
    begin
      ua (‚âÉ-sym Œ±)
        ‚â°‚ü® ap (_¬∑ ua (‚âÉ-sym Œ±)) (! (¬∑-linv (ua Œ±))) ‚ü©
      ! (ua Œ±) ¬∑ ua Œ± ¬∑ ua (‚âÉ-sym Œ±)
        ‚â°‚ü® ¬∑-assoc (! (ua Œ±)) _ _ ‚ü©
      ! (ua Œ±) ¬∑ (ua Œ± ¬∑ ua (‚âÉ-sym Œ±))
        ‚â°‚ü® ap (! (ua Œ±) ¬∑_) (ua-inv-r Œ±) ‚ü©
      ! (ua Œ±) ¬∑ refl _
        ‚â°‚ü® ! (¬∑-runit (! ((ua Œ±)))) ‚ü©
      ! (ua Œ±)
    ‚àé

Circles



The circle type is constructed by postulating a type with
a single element (base) and a nontrivial path (loop).



module CircleType where




  private
    data !S¬π : Type‚ÇÄ where
      !base : !S¬π

  S¬π : Type‚ÇÄ
  S¬π = !S¬π

  base : S¬π
  base = !base

  postulate
    loop : base == base




Recursion principle on points


  S¬π-rec
    : (A : Type ‚Ñì)
    ‚Üí (a : A)
    ‚Üí (p : a == a)
    --------------
    ‚Üí (S¬π ‚Üí A)

  S¬π-rec A a p !base = a




Recursion principle on paths


  postulate
    S¬π-Œ≤rec
      : (A : Type ‚Ñì)
      ‚Üí (a : A)
      ‚Üí (p : a == a)
      ------------------------------
      ‚Üí ap (S¬π-rec A a p) loop == p




Induction principle on points


  S¬π-ind
    : (P : S¬π ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì)
    ‚Üí (x : P base)
    ‚Üí (x == x [ P ‚Üì loop ])
    --------------------------
    ‚Üí ((t : S¬π) ‚Üí P t)

  S¬π-ind P x p !base = x




Induction principle on paths


  postulate
    S¬π-Œ≤ind
      : (P : S¬π ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì)
      ‚Üí (x : P base)
      ‚Üí (p : x == x [ P ‚Üì loop ])
      -------------------------------
      ‚Üí apd (S¬π-ind P x p) loop == p

Intervals



Interval. An interval is defined by taking two points (two elements) and a path
between them (an element of the equality type). This path is nontrivial.



module IntervalType where

  private

    data !I : Type‚ÇÄ where
      !Izero : !I
      !Ione : !I

  I : Type‚ÇÄ
  I = !I

  Izero : I
  Izero = !Izero

  Ione : I
  Ione = !Ione

  postulate
    seg : Izero == Ione




Recursion principle on points.


  I-rec
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí (a b : A)
    ‚Üí (p : a == b)
    --------------
    ‚Üí (I ‚Üí A)

  I-rec a _ _ !Izero = a
  I-rec _ b _ !Ione  = b




Recursion principle on paths.


  postulate
    I-Œ≤rec
      : (A : Type ‚Ñì)
      ‚Üí (a b : A)
      ‚Üí (p : a == b)
      ---------------------------
      ‚Üí ap (I-rec a b p) seg == p

Suspensions



module SuspensionType where

  module S where

  private
    data Susp‚Çö {‚Ñì} (A : Type ‚Ñì) : Type ‚Ñì where
      N‚Çö : Susp‚Çö A
      S‚Çö : Susp‚Çö A

    data Susp‚Çì {‚Ñì} (A : Type ‚Ñì) : Type ‚Ñì where
      mkSusp : Susp‚Çö A ‚Üí (ùüô {‚Ñì} ‚Üí ùüô {‚Ñì}) ‚Üí Susp‚Çì A

  Susp = Susp‚Çì

  -- point-constructors
  North : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì} {A : Type ‚Ñì} ‚Üí Susp A
  North = mkSusp N‚Çö _

  South : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì} {A : Type ‚Ñì} ‚Üí Susp A
  South = mkSusp S‚Çö _

  -- path-constructors
  postulate
    merid : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì} {A : Type ‚Ñì}
          ‚Üí A
          ‚Üí Path {‚Ñì}{Susp A} North South





Recursion principle on points


  Susp-rec
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{C : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (c‚Çô c‚Çõ  : C)
    ‚Üí (merid' : A ‚Üí c‚Çô == c‚Çõ)
    ------------------------
    ‚Üí (Susp A ‚Üí C)

  Susp-rec c‚Çô _ _ (mkSusp N‚Çö _) = c‚Çô
  Susp-rec _ c‚Çõ _ (mkSusp S‚Çö _) = c‚Çõ




Recursion principle on paths


  postulate
    Susp-Œ≤rec
      : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}{C : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
      ‚Üí {c‚Çô c‚Çõ : C} {mer : A ‚Üí c‚Çô == c‚Çõ}
      ‚Üí {a : A}
      -------------------------------------------
      ‚Üí ap (Susp-rec c‚Çô c‚Çõ mer) (merid a) == mer a




Induction principle on points


  Susp-ind
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì} {A : Type ‚Ñì} (C : Susp A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì)
    ‚Üí (N' : C North)
    ‚Üí (S' : C South)
    ‚Üí (merid' : (x : A) ‚Üí N' == S' [ C ‚Üì (merid x) ])
    --------------------------------------------------
    ‚Üí ((x : Susp A) ‚Üí C x)

  Susp-ind _ N' S' _ (mkSusp N‚Çö _) = N'
  Susp-ind _ N' S' _ (mkSusp S‚Çö _) = S'




Induction principle on paths


  postulate
    Susp-Œ≤ind
      : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì} {A : Type ‚Ñì} (C : Susp A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì)
      ‚Üí (N' : C North)
      ‚Üí (S' : C South)
      ‚Üí (merid' : (x : A) ‚Üí N' == S' [ C ‚Üì (merid x)]) {x : A}
      --------------------------------------------------------
      ‚Üí apd (Susp-ind C N' S' merid') (merid x) == merid' x

Propositional truncation



Propositional truncation (or reflection) is the universal
solution to the problem of mapping $X$ to a proposition $P$:



X  ‚Üí ‚à• X ‚à•
 ‚Üò    ‚á£ (!‚àÉ h)
    ‚Üò P 




Notes:



    
  
  • It‚Äôs possible to extend MLTT to get truncations for all types.
 (Such as resizing + funext, or higher inductive types.)
    • 




For a different way of formalising trucation see:
agd-premises.



module
  TruncationType
  where




  private
    data
      !‚à•_‚à• {‚Ñì} (A : Type ‚Ñì)
        : Type ‚Ñì
        where
        !‚à£_‚à£ : A ‚Üí !‚à• A ‚à•




  ‚à•_‚à•
    :  (A : Type ‚Ñì)
    ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì

  ‚à• A ‚à• = !‚à• A ‚à•

  prop-trunc = ‚à•_‚à• 




  ‚à£_‚à£
    : {X : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí X
    ‚Üí ‚à• X ‚à•

  ‚à£ x ‚à£ = !‚à£ x ‚à£

  ‚à•‚à•-intro = ‚à£_‚à£ 




Any two elements of the truncated type are equal



  postulate
    trunc
      : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
      ‚Üí isProp ‚à• A ‚à•




Recursion principle


  trunc-rec
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {P : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí isProp P
    ‚Üí (A ‚Üí P)
    ---------
    ‚Üí ‚à• A ‚à• ‚Üí P

  trunc-rec _ f !‚à£ x ‚à£ = f x

  trunc-elim = trunc-rec
  ‚à•‚à•-rec     = trunc-rec




There exists the possibility to charactherize, propositional truncation
using an impredicative approach, which means, our definition will lay on
a larger universe as follows on the right-hand side.





Remarks:



    
  
  • rhs is a propositon assuming funext
    • 
  
  • this equation tells us an important relation (a pattern) between
the type (in this case, prop-trunc) and its elimination principle (trunc-rec)
    • 
  
  • Impredicative means in this context: ‚Äúit is defined in terms of quantification over a family which the thing we are defining is a member of.‚Äù (Gylterud).
    • 




Truncation Lemmas



  truncated-is-prop
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí isProp (‚à• A ‚à•)
  truncated-is-prop = trunc

  ‚à•‚à•-is-a-prop = truncated-is-prop




  prop-‚âÉ-truncated
    : { A : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí isProp A
    ‚Üí ‚à• A ‚à• ‚âÉ A

  prop-‚âÉ-truncated pA = lemma333 trunc pA (trunc-rec pA id) ‚à£_‚à£

  trunc-‚âÉ = prop-‚âÉ-truncated 




A relation between double implication and the truncation of a type:



  postulate
   trunc-‚áî-¬¨¬¨
     : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì} {X : Type ‚Ñì}
     ‚Üí ‚à• X ‚à• ‚áî (¬¨ (¬¨ X))

Set truncations



module SetTruncationType where

  private
    -- Higher inductive type
    data !‚à•_‚à•‚ÇÄ {‚Ñì} (A : Type ‚Ñì) : Type ‚Ñì where
      !‚à£_‚à£‚ÇÄ : A ‚Üí !‚à• A ‚à•‚ÇÄ

  ‚à•_‚à•‚ÇÄ
    : (A : Type ‚Ñì)
    ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì

  ‚à• A ‚à•‚ÇÄ = !‚à• A ‚à•‚ÇÄ

  ‚à£_‚à£‚ÇÄ
    : {X : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí X
    ‚Üí ‚à• X ‚à•‚ÇÄ

  ‚à£ x ‚à£‚ÇÄ = !‚à£ x ‚à£‚ÇÄ

  postulate
    strunc
      : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
      ‚Üí isSet ‚à• A ‚à•‚ÇÄ




Recursion principle



  strunc-rec
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {P : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí isSet P
    ‚Üí (A ‚Üí P)
    ------------
    ‚Üí ‚à• A ‚à•‚ÇÄ ‚Üí P

  strunc-rec _ f !‚à£ x ‚à£‚ÇÄ = f x




Induction principle



  strunc-ind
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {B : ‚à• A ‚à•‚ÇÄ ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí ((a : ‚à• A ‚à•‚ÇÄ) ‚Üí isSet (B a))
    ‚Üí (g : (a : A) ‚Üí B ‚à£ a ‚à£‚ÇÄ)
    ------------------------------
    ‚Üí (a : ‚à• A ‚à•‚ÇÄ) ‚Üí B a

  strunc-ind _ g !‚à£ x ‚à£‚ÇÄ = g x




QuotientType.lagda

title: ‚ÄúQuotient Type‚Äù

‚Äî




  
{-# OPTIONS --without-K #-}
open import TransportLemmas
open import EquivalenceType

open import HomotopyType
open import FunExtAxiom
open import QuasiinverseType
open import DecidableEquality
open import NaturalType
open import HLevelTypes
open import HLevelLemmas
open import HedbergLemmas






module QuotientType where

  record QRel {‚Ñì} (A : Type ‚Ñì) : Type (lsuc ‚Ñì) where
    field
      R     : A ‚Üí A ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì
      Aset  : isSet A
      Rprop : (a b : A) ‚Üí isProp (R a b)

  open QRel  public

  private
    data _!/_ {‚Ñì} (A : Type ‚Ñì) (r : QRel A)
      : Type (lsuc ‚Ñì)
      where
      ![_] : A ‚Üí (A !/ r)

  _/_
    : (A : Type ‚Ñì) (r : QRel A)
    ‚Üí Type (lsuc ‚Ñì)

  A / r = (A !/ r)

  [_]
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì}
    ‚Üí A ‚Üí {r : QRel A}
    ---------
    ‚Üí (A / r)

  [ a ] = ![ a ]

  -- Equalities induced by the relation
  postulate
    Req
      : {A : Type ‚Ñì} {r : QRel A}
      ‚Üí {a b : A}
      ‚Üí R  a b
      --------------------
      ‚Üí [ a ] {r} == [ b ]

  -- The quotient of a set is again a set
  postulate
    Rtrunc
      : {A : Type ‚Ñì} {r : QRel A}
      ---------------
      ‚Üí isSet (A / r)




Recursion principle



  QRel-rec
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {r : QRel A} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí ((x y : A) ‚Üí R  x y ‚Üí f x == f y)
    ---------------------------------------
    ‚Üí A / r ‚Üí B

  QRel-rec f p ![ x ] = f x




Induction principle


  QRel-ind
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {r : QRel A} {B : A / r ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (f : ((a : A) ‚Üí B [ a ]))
    ‚Üí ((x y : A) ‚Üí (o : R  x y) ‚Üí (transport B (Req o) (f x)) == f y)
    -------------------
    ‚Üí (z : A / r) ‚Üí B z

  QRel-ind f p ![ x ] = f x




Recursion in two arguments



  QRel-rec-bi
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢} {r : QRel A} {B : Type ‚Ñì‚±º}
    ‚Üí (f : A ‚Üí A ‚Üí B)
    ‚Üí ((x y z t : A) ‚Üí R  x y ‚Üí R  z t ‚Üí f x z == f y t)
    -------------------
    ‚Üí A / r ‚Üí A / r ‚Üí B

  QRel-rec-bi f p ![ x ] ![ y ] = f x y




  Qrel-prod
    : {A : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢}
    ‚Üí (r : QRel A)
    --------------
    ‚Üí QRel (A √ó A)

  Qrel-prod r =
    record { R = Œª { (a , b) (c , d) ‚Üí (R  a c) √ó (R  b d) }
           ; Aset = isSet-prod (Aset ) (Aset )
           ; Rprop = Œª { (x , y) (q , w) ‚Üí isProp-prod (Rprop  x q) (Rprop  y w)} }

Monoids



A monoid is a algebraic structure on a set with a featured object called the
unit and an associative binary operation (also called the multiplication) that
fulfills certain properties described below.



Before monoids, we could define instead a much simpler structure, the magma. A
magma is basically a set and an binary operation. Then, any monoid is also
magma, but magmas are not so interesting as the monoids.



module
  MonoidType
    where




  record
    Monoid
      : Type (lsuc ‚Ñì)
      where
    constructor monoid
    field
      M    : Type ‚Ñì       -- The carrier
      e    : M            -- Unit element (at least one element, this one)
      _<>_ : M ‚Üí M ‚Üí M    -- Operation

      M-is-set : isSet M   -- the carrier is a set

      -- axioms:
      lunit : (x : M) ‚Üí (e <> x) == x
      runit : (x : M) ‚Üí (x <> e) == x
      assoc : (x y z : M) ‚Üí (x <> (y <> z)) == ((x <> y) <> z)




  open Monoid public

Groups



module
  GroupType

A group $G$ is a monoid with something else, inverses for each element.
This means, there is a function $\mathsf{inverse} : G ‚Üí G$ such that:





where $G$ is the group, $e$ the unit and $<>$ the operation from the underlined
monoid. This is the following type for groups:



  Group
    : ‚àÄ {‚Ñì} ‚Üí Type (lsuc ‚Ñì)

  Group
    = ‚àë (Monoid) (Œª {(monoid G e _<>_ GisSet lunit runit assoc)
      ‚Üí ‚àë (G ‚Üí G) (Œª inverse ‚Üí
        ‚àè G (Œª x ‚Üí
          -- properties:
          (   (x <> inverse x) == e)
          √ó ( (inverse x <> x) == e ))
          )})

Fundamental group



Definition of the fundamental group of a type.
Let a:A be one point of the type. The fundamental group on a is the
group given by proofs of the equality (a=a).



module FundamentalGroupType where




Definition of the fundamental group.


  Œ©
    : (A : Type ‚Ñì)
    ------------------
    ‚Üí (a : A) ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì
    
  Œ© A a = (a == a)




  Œ©-gr
    : (A : Type ‚Ñì)
    ‚Üí (a : A) ‚Üí Group {‚Ñì}
  Œ©-gr A a =
    monoid
      (Œ© A a)
      (refl a)
      _¬∑_
      (Œª x y p q ‚Üí _)
      (Œª (x : Œ© A a) ‚Üí refl x)
      (Œª (x : Œ© A a) ‚Üí ! (¬∑-runit x))
      (Œª x y z ‚Üí ! (¬∑-assoc x y z)  )
    , inv , Œª x ‚Üí ¬∑-rinv x , ¬∑-linv x
    where open import MonoidType

The Axiom Of Choice



module
  TheAxiomOfChoice
  where




Let‚Äôs write in type theory, the following logic formulation of
of the axiom of choice:





  postulate
    Choice
      :
      -- Asummption 1: 
        (B : Type ‚Ñì·µ¢)
      ‚Üí isSet B
      -- Asummption 2: 
      ‚Üí (A : B ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚±º)
      ‚Üí ‚àÄ (b : B) ‚Üí isSet (A b)
      -- Asummption 3:
      ‚Üí (P : (b : B) ‚Üí (A b) ‚Üí Type ‚Ñì‚Çñ)
      ‚Üí ‚àÄ (b : B)(a : A b) ‚Üí isProp (P b a)
      -----------------------------------
      ‚Üí (‚àÄ b ‚Üí ‚à• ‚àë (A b) (Œª a ‚Üí P b a) ‚à•)
      ‚Üí ‚à• ‚àë (‚àè B A) (Œª g ‚Üí P b (g b)) ‚à•
